environment for the citys employees and the general public it shall therefore be unlawful for any person to fail to comply with the provisions of this section  or any ordinance or resolution of the city of east point establishing a smoking policy within the public areas of the city it is hereby declared to be the policy of the city that smoking in enumerated public places shall be a public nuisance and dangerous to the public health and that no smoking and smoking permitted signs shall be posted in conspicuous places to assure notice smoking shall be generally not permitted in any public building and shall be generally permitted on any public grounds 2 smoking or the carrying of lighted tobacco or other substances in any form in areas designated no smoking and the smoking or discarding of any lighted or smoldering substance in any place or area where no smoking signs are posted is hereby prohibited and unlawful and any violation of this section shall be punishable as other offenses in the city court of east point 3 a departments will give this smoking policy wide dissemination to all employees b signs that are uniform in language and color shall be placed in all appropriate areas indicating no smoking or smoking permitted as hereinafter designated by mayor and council c all prospective new employees or appointees will be informed of this smoking policy prior to employment or appointment  3491 custodian of keys to municipal building the city clerk shall be custodian of keys to the municipal building in which is located the office of the city clerk and in which is located the council chamber of the city it shall be the duty of every person to whom a key is issued under this section upon suspension discharge or removal from the service of the city to immediately surrender the key to the custodian  duplicate keys it shall be unlawful for any person to make or cause to be made any duplicate of any key issued by the custodian under the provisions of section 4201 and in no case shall any key be duplicated except when authorized by the council it shall be the duty of the custodian however to obtain for each lock where keys may be necessary sufficient keys to have on hand two 2 keys in addition to those issued to persons authorized to use the offices  borrowing etc of keys  meaning of section it shall be unlawful for any officer agent or employee of the city to whom a key is issued to borrow obtain give lend or use any key not previously issued to such person officer agent or employee or which key was issued to another the meaning of this section is that no person shall use any key except the key issued to him under authority of the council and any effort to evade the provisions of this section by borrowing lending or giving a key or by using a key borrowed loaned or otherwise obtained without express authority from the city council is unlawful  loss or destruction of keys  temporary keys the loss or destruction of any key shall be immediately reported to the custodian by the person to whom the key was issued whereupon it shall be the duty of the custodian to report this fact to the next regular meeting of the city council the custodian may issue a temporary key to the person losing or destroying his key until the next regular meeting of the city council when such loss or destruction shall be reported to the council by the custodian after consideration of the report of the custodian of the loss or destruction of the key the council shall give direction in the premises as in its judgment the circumstances of the case may required  explosives belonging to city a purchase order required it shall be unlawful for any person to accept delivery of dynamite detonation caps or other explosives without a purchase order from the purchasing department of the city b delivery transportation to filter plant wherever delivery from magazine is made the explosives shall be transported immediately to the filter plant and properly sorted in the shelters provided therefor delivery shall be acknowledged in writing by the filter plant superintendent or other operator on duty at the time c duty of filter plant superintendent it shall be the duty of the filter plant superintendent to keep all explosives of the city under lock and key and to issue them to department heads or their authorized employees for the necessary use by the city d issuance  records all materials shall be issued upon written receipts which shall state the location of the job in progress and any unused explosives shall be properly returned to the storage houses and signed for by the operator in charge the filter plant superintendent shall keep an accurate record of the materials on hand and used during any month so that proper reports can be made to the state fire marshals office e authorized personnel each department head shall furnish the filter plant superintendent with the names of persons authorized to handle explosives and no other persons shall use explosives except under direct supervision of authorized persons 1 use of city funds property or services of personnel for private purposes prohibited a it shall be unlawful for city funds property or services of personnel to be used when or where it is primarily for the benefit of any private person as distinguished from the public it shall likewise be unlawful for any private person to receive any city funds property or services of city personnel under circumstances mentioned in this section b any person violating any provision of this section shall upon conviction thereof in the city court be punished as provided in section 11006 and if the offender be an officer or employee of the city the officer or employee shall in addition to other penalties imposed be subject to suspension definite or indefinite demotion removal or discharge in the discretion of the city council  donations of city property and funds to churches etc remove or carry away any of the shrubbery hedges flowers or trees about the public grounds parks or buildings of the city  same  liability for use of city buildings or property any person using any city building or property shall be liable for any damages to the buildings as a result of the use  sale of property  generally when it is deemed advisable to dispose of any personal property belonging to the city and used in the various departments thereof or under the supervision of the council the sale of the property shall be made by the purchasing agent the purchasing agent shall confer with the head of the department selling the property with the view to getting the best price possible in making the sale this section is not intended to authorize the sale of the property without a resolution of the council but where a resolution has for any reason provided for the sale of any such property belonging to the city the sale of the property shall be supervised by the purchasing agent acting with the proper official of the city familiar with and in charge of the property proposed to be sold  same  or purchase where value exceeds $1000 except as otherwise provided by law no purchase or sale contract in excess of one thousand dollars $100000 may be lawfully made by the city without first obtaining competitive sealed bids unless an emergency makes it unwise to take necessary time to secure the bids in all purchases the city shall accept the lowest and best bid if it accepts any and in all sales by the city the highest and best bid shall be accepted if any are accepted  but the city shall in all cases reserve the right to reject any and all bids  provided this section shall not apply to marshals sales if an owners right to redeem exists after the sale but it shall apply to all public improvement contracts and to all other real estate sales but shall not apply to real estate purchases nor to any other contract if its application thereto would clearly increase the citys cost it shall not apply to contracts of employment see act approved  ga l 1957 1 annotation this ordinance does not make it mandatory for the city to obtain competitive bids in all sales of real estate and the ordinance does not apply to real estate purchases  the courts will not control the discretion of a municipality in disposing of its property unless such discretion is manifestly abused watson v city of east point 223 ga 185 187 1967 same  worn out and useless property when any property owned by the city in the possession of its various departments has become worn out or useless or has become junk or has been used to such an extent that it is advisable to dispose of same the head of the department in charge of the property shall certify to the purchasing committee that certain itemized property is in possession of the department and is no longer useful in the service of the city  and thereupon the purchasing agent shall at public sale sell the property and turn the proceeds thereof over to the city treasurer crediting the department from which the property was obtained with the amount of same no sale of the property shall be made by the equipment supplies services construction professional or consultant services the need for which was unforeseen or not anticipated when the abovedetailed estimates were filed  and b revisory power of purchasing agent the purchasing agent shall examine each requisition or estimate and shall have the authority to revise it as to quantity quality or estimated cost  provided that the needs of the departments are met and revisions as to quality and quantity shall be made in accordance with standards and specifications established pursuant to this chapter 3 estimates all departments shall file with the purchasing agent within thirty 30 days after the adoption of the annual budget and quarterly thereafter estimates of their needs for the procurement of equipment supplies services construction and professional or consultant services for the ensuing fiscal year or calendar quarter the purchasing agent shall utilize such estimates for the scheduling of work activities and of procurements to be made by the purchasing agent the purchasing agent shall compile and consolidate all estimates of supplies needed by the departments to determine total requirements of a given commodity 4 list of authorized signatures all heads of departments shall provide the purchasing agent annually with a list of signatures of persons in the department who are authorized to sign requisitions on behalf of the department 5 examination of contracts the purchasing agent and the head of the department shall examine all contracts to determine the accuracy of the substance and the procured under city contracts  7395 further authorization of city council  when required the purchasing agent shall have the authority to enter into and sign contracts on behalf of the city pursuant authorized by law all city contracts in an amount greater than twelve thousand five dollars $1250000 except for the purchase sale and disposition of real estate shall be awarded by competitive sealed bidding pursuant to section 43302 competitive sealed bidding except as provided in 1 competitive sealed proposals  2 small purchases  3 sole source procurement  4 emergency procurement  5 competitive selection procedures for professional and consultant services  6 recurring inventory items  7 disposition of surplus supplies 8 aggregated purchasing groups  7395   competitive sealed bidding 1 conditions for use contracts or purchase orders shall be awarded by competitive sealed bidding except as otherwise provided in section 43301 methods of source selection 2 invitations for bids an invitation for bids shall be issued and shall include a purchase description and all contractual terms and conditions applicable to the procurement 3 public notice where the estimated contract is in excess of twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 an advertisement inviting bids shall be published at least once a week for two 2 consecutive weeks in at least one 1 newspaper of general circulation in the city at least fourteen 14 days preceding the date set for receipt of bids notice of bid security if required shall be included in the public notice the public notice shall contain a general description of the equipment supplies services construction and professional or consultant services to be procured and shall state the location of where appropriate solicitation documents may be obtained and the time and place of opening of solicitation documents 4 bidders list the issuance of a public notice shall not be required where the estimated amount of the contract does not exceed twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 and the purchasing agent has established and maintains a current bidders list the bidders list must contain more than an adequate number of vendors with the capacity to furnish the service or supplies required further the list shall constitute a reasonable representation of all prospective vendors in the market place 5 clock calibration prior to all bid openings the purchasing agent or staff shall coordinate the clock calibration used in the bid process with the national bureau of standards 6 bid opening bids shall be opened publicly in the presence of one 1 or more witnesses at the time and place designated in the invitation for bids the name of each bidder the amount of each bid and such other relevant information as the purchasing agent deems appropriate shall be recorded the record and each bid shall be open to public inspection 7 bid acceptance bids shall be unconditionally accepted without alteration or correction except as authorized in this chapter  provided that the bids are delivered to the purchasing agent at the time place and under the conditions contained in the invitation for bids 8 bid evaluation bids shall be evaluated based on the requirements set forth in the invitation for bids the criteria that will affect the bid price and be considered in evaluation for award shall be objectively measurable such as discounts transportation costs and total or life cycle costs the invitation for bids shall set forth the evaluation criteria to be used including but not limited to inspection testing quality workmanship delivery and suitability for a particular purpose no criteria may be used in bid evaluation that are not set forth in the invitation for bids 9 correction or withdrawal of bids a before bid opening correction or withdrawal of bids may be allowed by the purchasing agent before the scheduled time and date of bid opening the bidder may withdraw the bid without revealing the amount of the bid by submitting a new sealed bid or providing written notice of withdrawal before bid opening notice of withdrawal must be received by the purchasing agent prior to bid opening b after bid opening mistakes or errors in bids discovered by the purchasing agent or bidder after bid opening may be corrected or withdrawal of bids may be allowed in accordance with this section a bidder who discovers a mistake or error in the bid may request relief from the purchasing agent  and the purchasing agent may allow relief as prescribed below i clerical mistakes any obvious clerical mistake including but not limited to an error in price extension placement of decimal points reversal of prices fob destination or fob point of origination may be corrected by the purchasing agent after written verification is made by the bidder ii corrections a written determination is made that the following conditions are met 1 evidence of the mistake and the bid intended is clear and convincing on the face of the bid  and 2 the bid received and as actually intended is the lowest responsive bid received provided that if there is no clear and convincing evidence the bidder shall not be permitted to withdraw the bid without prejudice or to correct the error  and upon failure to enter into contract such bidder shall forfeit the bid security iii withdrawal if there is a significant and obvious disparity between the prices of the lowest bidder and of the other bidders a bidder may be permitted to withdraw without prejudice upon submission of evidence that a nonintentional error occurred provided that a withdrawal of bid shall not be allowed without prejudice unless clear and convincing evidence exists to support the error 10 tie bids in the event two 2 or more bidders are tied in price while otherwise meeting all of the required conditions the contract shall be awarded to a bidder whose principal place of business is within the city 11 award the contract shall be awarded with reasonable promptness by written notice to the lowest responsible and responsive bidder whose bid meets the requirements and criteria set forth in the invitation for bids provided however that the city reserves the right to reject all bids in the event all bids exceed available funds as certified by the city treasurer and the low responsive bid does not exceed such funds by more than five 5 percent the purchasing agent is authorized when time or economic considerations preclude resolicitation of work of a reduced scope to negotiate an adjustment of the bid price including changes in the bid requirements with the low responsible and responsive bidder in order to bring the bid within the amount of available funds 12 multistep sealed bidding when it is considered impractical to initially prepare a purchase description to support an award based on price an invitation for bids may be issued requesting the submission of unpriced offers to be followed by an invitation for bids limited to those bidders whose offers have been qualified under the criteria set forth in the first solicitation  7395 competitive sealed proposals 1 conditions for use when the purchasing agent determines that the use of competitive sealed bidding is neither practicable nor advantageous to the city a contract may be entered into by the use of the competitive sealed proposals method 2 request for proposals proposals shall be solicited request for proposals 3 public notice public notice of the request for proposals shall be given in the same manner as provided in section 433023 competitive sealed bidding public notice 4 proposal opening proposals shall be publicly opened and only the names of the offerors shall be disclosed at the opening contents of competing offerors proposals shall not be disclosed during the process of negotiation proposals shall be open for public inspection only after contract award proprietary or confidential information marked as such in each proposal shall not be disclosed without written consent of the offeror 5 evaluation factors the request for proposals shall state the relative importance of evaluation factors 6 discussion with responsible offerors and revisions to proposals discussions may be conducted with responsible offerors who submit proposals determined to be reasonably susceptible of being selected for award for the purpose of clarification to assure full understanding of and responsiveness to the solicitation requirements offerors shall be accorded fair and equal treatment with respect to any opportunity for discussion and revision of proposals and such revisions may be permitted after submissions and prior to the deadline for submission for the purpose of obtaining best and final offers in conducting discussions there shall be no disclosure of information derived from proposals submitted by competing offerors 7 award award shall be made to the responsible offeror whose proposal is determined in writing to be the most advantageous to the city taking into consideration the evaluation factors set forth in the request for proposals no other factors or criteria shall be used in the evaluation the contract file shall contain the basis on which the award was made  7395 small purchases 1 general procedures any contract or purchase order for equipment supplies services and construction not exceeding twelve thousand five hundred dollars $1250000 may be made without public notice in accordance with small purchase procedures adopted by the purchasing agent in accordance with this chapter contract requirements shall not be artificially divided so as to constitute a small purchase under this section to the extent possible said purchases shall be made from the vendors on the current bidders list maintained by the purchasing agent pursuant to section 433024 of this chapter 2 small purchases under two thousand five hundred dollars $250000 the purchasing agent shall adopt operational procedures for making small purchases of up to two thousandfive hundred dollars $250000 or less by authorized persons other than the purchasing staff such operational procedures shall provide for obtaining adequate and reasonable competition for the equipment supply service or construction being purchased further such operational procedures shall require the preparation and maintenance of written records adequate to document the competition obtained properly account for the funds expended and facilitate an audit of the small purchase made 3 competitive quotations contracts or purchases for amounts equaling twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 or less may be authorized by the purchasing agent for equipment supplies services or minor construction use of competitive quotations quotations of this nature may be oral or written however the company name telephone number and contact person for all competitive parties shall be made available as a bid record for scrutiny and must meet the test of sections 433202 contract audit and section 43321 reporting anticompetitive practices  7395   sole and single source procurement a contract may be awarded without competition when the purchasing agent determines in writing after conducting a good faith review of available sources that there is only one 1 source for the required equipment supply service construction item or professional or consultant service the purchasing agent shall conduct negotiations as appropriate as to price delivery and terms a record of sole source procurements shall be maintained that lists each contractors name the name and type of each contract a listing of the items procured under each contract and the identification number of each contract file  7395 emergency procurement notwithstanding any other provisions of this chapter where the purchasing agent determines that an emergency exists the purchasing agent may make or authorize others to make emergency procurements or equipment supplies services construction items or professional or consultant services when the purchasing agent determines there exists a threat to public health welfare or safety under emergency conditions such emergency procurements shall be made with as much competition as is practicable under the circumstances a written determination of the basis for the emergency and for the selection of the particular contractor shall be included in the contract file as soon as practicable a record of each emergency procurement shall be made and shall set forth the contractors name the amount and type of the contract a listing of the items procured under the contract and the identification number of the contract file  7395 competitive selection procedures for professional and consultant services 1 conditions for use the purchasing agent upon the request or recommendation of the department as provided in section 43205 requirements upon using departments shall procure professional and consultant services in accordance with this section except as authorized under section 43305 sole source procurement and section 43306 emergency procurement 2 statement of qualifications in the procurement of professional and consultant services the purchasing agent shall request persons to submit statements of interest in providing such types of services with their statement of qualifications and performance data for inclusion in a professional or consultant qualifications list that shall be maintained by the purchasing agent each using department shall encourage professional and consultant firms which desire to provide services to the department to submit statements of qualifications to the purchasing agent the purchasing agent may specify a uniform format for statements of qualifications persons may amend these statements at any time by filing a new statement any person placed on the qualifications list shall be removed if found in violation of this article within this chapter or in default of any contract with the city 3 public notice where the estimated cost is in excess of twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 the purchasing agent shall issue public notice for request for proposals from professional and consultant offerors as provided in section 433023 competitive sealed bidding public notice the public notice for request for proposals shall describe the services required list the type of information and data required of each offeror and state the relative importance of particular qualifications 4 selection process the purchasing agent in consultation with the head of the department and upon the recommendation of the head of the department shall conduct discussions regarding the contract and shall select from among the offerors no less than three 3 offerors deemed most qualified to provide the required services provided that the purchasing agent may waive the requirement of three 3 offerors upon the written determination that three 3 firms are not available to perform the proposed professional or consultant services the selection shall be made in order of preference based upon criteria established and published by the purchasing agent with the recommendation of the department head the criteria shall include but not be limited to the following factors a previous experience demonstrating competence to perform work involved in the project  b past performance of previous contracts with respect to time of completion and quality of work  c the fee or compensation demanded for the work or services  d the ability to comply with the applicable ordinances and resolutions of the city the regulations and ordinances of the county in which the work is to be performed and the laws of the state of georgia and the united states  e the ability to comply with the schedule of the commencement and completion of the work or services as required by the city  f the financial ability to furnish the necessary bonds  g the financial condition of the professional or consultant  and h the ability to provide staffing of management personnel to the project satisfactory to the city 5 negotiations and award the purchasing agent shall negotiate a contract with the most qualified firm for the professional or consultant services to be performed at compensation which the purchasing agent determines in writing to be fair and reasonable to the city in making this decision the purchasing agent shall take into account the estimated value the scope the complexity and the professional nature of the services to be rendered should the purchasing agent be unable to negotiate a satisfactory contract with the firm considered to be the most qualified at a price the purchasing agent determines to be fair and reasonable to the city negotiations with that firm shall be formally terminated the purchasing agent shall then undertake negotiations with the second most qualified firm failing accord with the second most qualified firm the purchasing agent shall undertake negotiations with the third most qualified firm should the purchasing agent be unable to negotiate a contract at a fair and reasonable price with any of the selected firms the purchasing agent and the using department shall select additional firms in order of their competence and qualifications and the purchasing agent shall continue negotiations in accordance with this section until an agreement is reached after reaching an agreement the proposed contract will be sent back to council for final approval prior to its execution by the purchasing agent and the mayor  7395   3303 cancellation of invitations for bids or requests for proposals an invitation for bids a request for proposals or other solicitation may be canceled or any or all bids or proposals may be rejected in whole or in part as may be specified in the solicitation when it is for good cause and in the best interest of the city the reasons therefor shall be made part of the contract file each solicitation issued by the city shall state that the solicitation may be cancelled and that any bid or proposal may be rejected in whole or in part for good cause when in the best interest of the city notice of cancellation shall be sent to all businesses solicited the notice shall identify the solicitation explain the reasons for cancellation and where appropriate explain that opportunity be given to compete on any resolicitation or any future procurements of similar items  7395 responsibility of bidders and offerors 1 determination of responsibility responsibility of the bidder or offeror shall be ascertained for each contract awarded by the city based upon full disclosure to the purchasing agent concerning capacity to meet the terms of the contract and based upon past record of performance of similar contracts 2 determination of nonresponsibility if a bidder or offeror who otherwise would have been awarded a contract is found nonresponsible a written determination of nonresponsibility setting forth the basis of the finding shall be prepared by the purchasing agent the unreasonable failure of a bidder or offeror to supply prompt information in connection with an inquiry with respect to responsibility may be grounds for a determination of nonresponsibility a copy of the determination shall be sent to the nonresponsible bidder or offeror the final determination shall be made part of the contract file and be made a public record  7395 bid security for nonconstruction contracts 1 requirement for bid security bid security shall be required for all competitive sealed bidding for authorized to do business in the state of georgia or the equivalent in cash cashiers check or certified check nothing herein prevents the requirement of such bonds on contracts for supplies and services under one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 when the purchasing agent determines that the circumstances warrant such requirement 2 amount of bid security bid security shall be in an amount equal to at least five 5 percent of the amount of the bid unsuccessful bidders shall be entitled to the return of the bid security upon failure of a successful bidder to enter into a contract within ten 10 days after the purchasing agent tenders the proposed contract the bidder shall forfeit the bid security 3 rejection of bids for noncompliance with the bid security requirement when the invitation for bids requires security the bid shall be rejected if the purchasing agent determines that the bid fails to comply in a substantial manner with the security requirements 4 withdrawal of bids if a bidder is permitted to withdraw its bid before the deadline for submission as provided in section 433029a competitive sealed bidding correction or withdrawal of bids no action shall be had against the bidder or bid security  7395 performance and payment bonds for construction contracts 1 when required amounts when a contract for supplies or services is awarded in excess of one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 or when a contract for professional or consultant services is awarded and the purchasing agent determines that the circumstances so warrant the following bonds or security shall be delivered to the city and shall become binding on the parties upon the execution of the contract a a performance bond satisfactory to the city executed by a surety company authorized to do business in the state of georgia or otherwise secured in a manner satisfactory to the city in an amount equal to one hundred 100 percent of the price specified in the contract  and b a payment bond satisfactory to the city executed by a surety company authorized to do business in the state of georgia or otherwise secured in a manner satisfactory to the city for the protection of all persons supplying labor and material to the contractor or its subcontractor for the performance of the work provided for in the contract the bond shall be in an amount equal to one hundred 100 percent of the price specified in the contract 2 reduction or waiver of bond the purchasing agent is authorized to reduce or waive performance and payment bonds for contracts for equipment supplies and services for one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 or less when the purchasing agent makes a written determination that it is in the best interests of the city to do so nothing herein prevents the requirement of such bonds on supply or service contracts under one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 when the circumstances warrant the purchasing agent is authorized to reduce or waive payment bonds on contracts for professional or consultant services when the purchasing agent determines it is in the best interests of the city 3 authority to require additional bonds nothing in this section shall be construed to limit the authority of the city to require a performance or payment bond or other security in addition to those bonds or in circumstances other than those specified in subsections 1 and 2 of this section 4 suits on payment bonds right to institute any person who has furnished labor or material to the contractor for the work provided in the contract for which a payment bond is furnished under this section and who had not been paid in full within ninety 90 days from the date on which that person performed the last of the labor or supplied the material shall have the right to sue on the payment bond for any amount unpaid at the time the suit is instituted and to prosecute the action for the amount due that person 5 suits on payment bonds where and when brought every suit instituted upon a payment bond shall be brought in a court of competent jurisdiction for the county or district in which the contract for equipment supplies services construction and professional or consultant services was to be performed  but no such suit shall be commenced after the expiration of one 1 year after the day on which the last of the labor was performed or material was supplied by the person bringing suit the obligee named in the bond need not be joined as a party of any such suit  7395 insurance requirements 1 general insurance requirements the purchasing agent in consultation with the such purposes 3 multiple source contracting a general a multiple source award is an award of an indefinite quantity contract for one or more similar supplies or services to more than one bidder or offeror the obligation to order the citys actual requirements is limited to such requirements as may occur in good faith pursuant to ocga 1 b limitations on use a multiple source award may be made when award to two 2 or more bidders or offerors for similar products is necessary for adequate delivery service or product compatibility any multiple source award shall be made in accordance with the provisions of competitive sealed bidding competitive sealed proposals small purchases and emergency procurements as applicable multiple source awards shall not be made when a single award will meet the citys needs without sacrifice of economy or service awards shall not be made for the purpose of dividing the business making available product or supplier selection to allow for user preference unrelated to utility or economy or avoiding the resolution of tie bids any such awards shall be limited to the least number of suppliers necessary to meet the requirements of this section c contract and solicitation provisions all eligible users of the contract shall be identified in the solicitation and it shall be mandatory that the actual requirements of such users that can be met under the contract be obtained in accordance with the contract provided that i the city shall reserve the right to take bids separately if a particular quantity requirement arises which exceeds its normal requirement or an amount specified in the contract  and ii the city shall reserve the right to take bids separately if the purchasing agent approves a finding that the supply or service available under the contract will not meet a nonrecurring special need of the city d intent to use if a multiple source award is anticipated prior to issuing a solicitation the city shall reserve the right to make such an award and the criteria for the award shall be stated in the solicitation e determination required the purchasing agent shall make a written determination setting forth the reasons for a multiple source award which shall be made a part of the procurement file  7395 extension and expiration of contracts 1 extension the purchasing agent may extend a contract once for ninety 90 days for competitive proposals by the city 3 application of local preference to specific procurement activity in an effort to nurture small and large businesses create jobs boost local economic activity economic relationship within the city this provision is applicable only to the citys acquisition of materials equipment or services request for proposal rfp or request for qualification rfq process as provided in code sections 43303 43307 and 43313 4 method of granting local preference a each corporation partnership sole proprietorship franchise or other business form seeking local preference manager of contracts and procurement b any local vendor who has been determined by the manager of contracts and procurement to be otherwise responsive and responsible which also provides proof of its of a contract is in violation of law then the solicitation or proposed award shall be cancelled or revised to comply with the law 3 remedies after award if after an award the purchasing agent after the city council by a duly enacted resolution may reject a bid offer or other response to the city solicitation or cancel any contract because of any false representation contained in or made in conjunction with an invitation for bids request for proposals or any other solicitation of the city  7395 conflicts of interest it shall be unethical for any city employee to participate directly or indirectly in a procurement contract when the city employee knows that a the city employee or any members of the city employees family has a financial interest pertaining to the procurement contract  or b any other person business or organization with whom the city employee or any member of a city employees immediate family is negotiating or has an arrangement concerning prospective employment is involved in the procurement contract a city employee or any member of a city employees immediate family who holds a financial interest in a disclosed blind trust shall be not deemed to have a conflict of interest with regard to matters pertaining to that financial interest  7395 gratuities and kickbacks 1 gratuities it shall be unethical for any person to offer give or agree to give any employee or former employee or for any employee or former employee to solicit demand accept or agree to accept from another person a gratuity or an offer of employment in connection with any decision approval disapproval recommendation preparation or any part of a program requirement or a purchase request influencing the content of any specification or procurement standard rendering of advice investigation auditing or in any other advisory capacity in any proceeding or application request for ruling determination claim or controversy or other particular matter pertaining to any program requirement or a contract or subcontract or to any solicitation or proposal therefor 2 kickbacks it shall be unethical for any payment gratuity or offer of employment to be made by or on behalf of a subcontractor under a contract to the prime contractor or higher tier subcontractor or any person associated therewith as an inducement for the award of a subcontract or order 3 contract clause the prohibition against gratuities and kickbacks prescribed in this section shall be conspicuously set forth in every contract and solicitation therefor  7395 prohibition against contingent fees 1 prohibition against contingent fees it shall be unethical for a person to be retained or to retain a person to solicit or secure a city contract upon an agreement or understanding for a commission percentage brokerage or contingent fee except for retention of bona fide employees of bona fide established commercial selling agencies for the purpose of securing business  7395 contemporaneous employment unless otherwise provided herein it shall be unethical under this article for any employee who is participating directly or indirectly in the procurement process to become or to be while such an employee the employee of any person contracting with the governmental body by whom the employee is employed  7395 use of confidential information in accordance with this article it shall be unethical for any employee or former employee willfully to use confidential information for actual or anticipated personal gain or for the actual or anticipated personal gain of any other person  7395 penalties 1 criminal penalties to the extent that violations of the ethical standards of conduct set forth in this article constitute violations of the georgia state or violations of the city standards of conduct they shall be punishable as provided therein such penalties shall be in addition to the civil sanctions set forth in this article criminal civil and administrative sanctions against employees or nonemployees which are in existence on the effective date of this ordinance shall not be impaired 2 sanctions a employees the city manager may impose any one 1 or more of the following sanctions on an employee for violations of the ethical standards contained in this article i oral or written warnings or reprimands  ii suspension with or without pay for specified periods of time  or iii termination of employment b nonemployees the city council may impose any one 1 or more of the following sanctions on a nonemployee for violations of the ethical standards i written warnings or reprimands  ii termination of contracts  or iii debarment or suspension in the citys bidding and contracting processes  7395 recovery of value transferred or received in breach of ethical standards 1 general requirement the value of anything transferred or received in breach of the ethical standards of this chapter by an employee or a nonemployee may be recovered from both the employee and nonemployee 2 recovery of kickbacks by the city upon a showing that a subcontractor made a kickback to a prime contractor or a higher tier subcontractor in connection with the award of a subcontract or order thereunder it shall be conclusively presumed that the amount thereof was included in the price of the subcontract or order and ultimately borne by the city and will be recoverable hereunder from the recipient in addition that amount may also be recovered from the subcontractor making such kickbacks recovery from one offending party shall not preclude recovery from other offending parties  7395 the city of east point footnotes  7  editors note  adopted  added a new ch 5 to as herein set out  adopted nov 7 199 amended the caption of without amending the text of said ordinance definitions in this chapter mediation means a process whereby a neutral third person called a mediator acts to encourage and facilitate the resolution of a dispute between two 2 or more parties it is an informal and nonadversarial process with the objective of helping the disputing parties reach a mutually acceptable and voluntary agreement in mediation decisionmaking authority rests with the parties the role of the mediator includes but is not limited to assisting the parties in identifying issues fostering joint problemsolving and exploring settlement alternatives  71894 policies it is the policy of the city to encourage the peaceful resolution of disputes process of mediation it is the opinion of the city that the increased utilization of the mediation process will result in tangible benefits to both the city itself as well as its citizenry including but not limited to savings in actual monies spent on litigation as well as increased efficiencies in the operations of the city and the judicial system at large  71894 referral of pending disputes for mediation a in instances where an employee has made a request for the submittal of a matter to mediation pursuant to section 41012b hereof such submittal shall be mandatory upon the city b in addition the city or its officials may on its own motion or the motion of a party refer to mediation any matter whereby an aggrieved employee or third party asserts a claim against the city or any of its employees or officials however such referrals shall be made only in the sole discretion of the city and only with the consent of the aggrieved party and shall further be made in accordance with the provisions of this chapter such claim shall be screened by the city either on its own or in cooperation with a mediator to determine whether the claim is appropriate for mediation  71894 notification a all thirdparty claimants filing an action against the city shall be informed in writing of the existence of the city of east points mediation system by the mailing of a copy of this to such address as is listed for said thirdparty claimant within the action filed furthermore if the city determines that a third partys claim is appropriate for referral to mediation the city shall notify the aggrieved party of its determination and shall actively encourage the third party to agree to submit the matter to mediation in accordance with the provisions of this notice letter shall contain a brief statement advising the aggrieved party that in the event the matter is ultimately submitted to mediation each party shall be responsible for the payment of onehalf  of the costs associated with the mediators services and that each party shall be solely responsible for their own attorney fees if any incurred in relation thereto b the aggrieved party may at any time after its receipt of the notice under subsection 45004a notify the city in writing of its objection to the referral c in the event the third party objects to the referral the city may not refer the dispute to mediation in the event the third party agrees to submit the dispute to mediation the city shall go forward with such submittal in accordance with the provisions of this chapter  71894 appointment of impartial mediator a if the city refers a pending dispute for resolution to mediation pursuant to this chapter the city may appoint a mediator to facilitate this procedure b the city may appoint a mediator who is agreed on by the parties if the person otherwise qualifies for appointment under this chapter c the city may appoint more than one mediator under this chapter  71894 qualifications of mediator a except as provided by subsection 45006b to qualify for an appointment as a mediator under this chapter a person must have completed a minimum of forty 40 classroom hours of training in dispute resolution techniques in a course conducted by an alternative dispute resolution center or other dispute resolution organization approved by the city b the city may in its discretion appoint a person as a mediator who does not qualify under subsection 45006a if the city bases its appointment on legal or other professional training or experience in a particular dispute resolution process  71894 standards and duties of mediator a a mediator appointed under this chapter shall encourage and assist the city and the aggrieved party in reaching a settlement of their dispute  however the mediator may not compel or coerce the parties to enter into a settlement agreement b unless expressly authorized by the disclosing party the mediator may not disclose to either party information given in confidence by the other and shall at all times maintain confidentiality with respect to communications relating to the subject matter of the dispute  71894 compensation of mediator the city shall pay all fees associated with the services of a mediator appointed under sections 41012b 41070 section 41071d or section 41072 out of the general operating funds of the city the city and the aggrieved third party shall each be responsible for the payment of onehalf  of the fees associated with the services of any mediator appointed under section 45004c hereof however both employees and aggrieved third parties utilizing the mediation process as provided for herein shall be solely responsible for their own attorney fees if any incurred in relation thereto  71894 effect of written agreement if mediation process the parties reach a settlement and execute a written agreement disposing of the dispute the agreement is enforceable in the same manner as any other written agreement however notwithstanding the foregoing no agreement reached in any mediation shall be enforceable against the city unless and except such agreement has been approved by duly authorized city officials in the same manner as is provided for in this the approval of other binding agreements with the city  71894 confidentiality of communications in mediation a unless the parties agree otherwise all matters including the conduct and demeanor of the parties and their counsel during a mediation are confidential and may never be disclosed to anyone b any statement made during a mediation or early neutral evaluation conference whether before or after the institution of formal judicial proceedings is confidential not subject to disclosure and may not be used as evidence in any subsequent administrative or judicial proceeding c any document or other evidence generated in connection with a mediation or case evaluation or early neutral evaluation is not subject to discovery an agreement resulting from a mediation or case evaluation or early neutral evaluation conference is not immune from discovery unless the parties agree in writing otherwise discoverable material is not rendered immune from discovery by use in a mediation or case evaluation or early neutral evaluation d neither the neutral nor any observer present with permission of the parties in a mediation may be subpoenaed or otherwise required to testify concerning a mediation or case evaluation or early neutral evaluation conference in any subsequent administrative or judicial proceeding a neutrals notes or records or records of the mediation program are not subject to discovery e in his or her opening statement the neutral should discuss any limitation on confidentiality imposed by any statutory duty to report information f observation by neutraltrainees with the consent of the parties does not breach the confidentiality of a mediation or case evaluation or early neutral evaluation conference g if this subsection conflicts with other legal requirements for disclosure of communications or materials the issue of confidentiality may be presented to a court of competent jurisdiction of the proceedings to determine in camera whether the facts circumstances and context of the communications or materials sought to be disclosed warrant a protective order of the court or whether communications or materials are subject to disclosure  71894 agreements reached in mediations notwithstanding any other provision contained herein to the contrary any and all agreements reached in any mediation involving the city must ultimately be approved by duly authorized city officials before becoming binding on the city  71894 additional rules relating to mediation process the city shall have the power to establish further rules applicable to the mediation process to further the established goals of this chapter  71894 chapter 6  domestic partnership article a  general provisions introduction the city of east point shall provide with respect to the city programs and services equal treatment to the residents of the city and employees of the city to the extent allowed by the terms and procedures of such programs and services  4405 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning a declaration of domestic partnership shall mean a form provided by the city business license office in which two 2 people agree to be jointly responsible for the necessities of life incurred during the domestic partnership and that all qualifications for domestic partnership are met when the declaration is signed the form will require both partners to provide reasonable proof of their primary regular and permanent residence address the form must be signed under penalty of perjury and must be witnessed and notarized the business license office shall within thirty 30 days of the effective date of this ordinance make such forms available to help defray costs associated with the providing and filing of these forms the business license office is authorized to charge a fee as set forth herein for each completed form b domestic partnership shall mean two 2 adults who live together in the mutual interdependence of a single home and have signed a declaration of domestic partnership in which they attest that 1 they share the same primary regular and permanent residence and have lived together for the previous twelve 12 months documentation must be submitted verifying joint residency  2 they have a committed personal relationship with each other that is mutually interdependent and intended to be lifelong  3 they agree to be jointly obligated and responsible for the necessities of life for each other  4 they are not married to anyone or legally separated from anyone  5 they are eighteen 18 years of age or older  6 they are of the same gender  7 they are competent to enter into a contract  8 they are not related by blood closer than would bar marriage in the state  9 they are each others sole domestic partner  10 they agree to file a termination of domestic partnership within thirty 30 days if any of the facts set out in this definition change  and 11 any prior domestic partnership in which their domestic partner participated with a third party was terminated not less than twelve 12 months prior to the date of such affidavit and if such earlier domestic partnership had been acknowledged under provisions of this section that notice of termination of such earlier domestic partnership was provided to the city in writing to the business license division of the department of finance not less than twelve 12 months prior to the date of said affidavit if the prior domestic partnership was terminated by the death of the partner there shall be no waiting period c live together shall mean that two 2 people claiming domestic partnership status share the same primary regular and permanent residence it is not necessary that the legal right to possess the residence be in both names domestic partners do not cease to live together if one leaves the shared residence for a period not to exceed one 1 year but intends to return whether the relationship between these two people is or is not sexual is in no way relevant for the purposes of determining eligibility under this chapter d necessities of life shall mean the cost of basic food shelter clothing and medical care the individuals need not contribute equally or jointly to the cost of these expenses as long as they agree that both are responsible and obligated for the cost  4405 legal effect of declaration a rights and duties created 1 neither this chapter nor the filing of a declaration of domestic partnership shall create any legal rights or duties from one of the parties to the other except those that specifically refer to domestic partnership 2 nothing in this chapter shall be construed to explicitly or implicitly create a marital relationship 3 nothing contained in this chapter shall create any rights in either domestic partner that are not covered included or created in the underlying insurance or benefits plan documents of the city 4 this chapter does not attempt to alter or affect the laws in the state that regulate any private or civil relationships b duration of rights and duties once a domestic partnership ends the partners will incur no further obligations to each other under this chapter  4405 establishment a generally domestic partners who are residents of the city or who are employees of the city may establish the existence of their domestic partnership by presenting an original declaration of domestic partnership to the business license office of the city along with reasonable proof of residence such as but not limited to a drivers license utility bill or state id card the business license office will file the declaration and provide the partners with a certificate showing that the declaration was filed with the business license office the standard declaration form will be available in the business license office during normal business hours b limitations the business office shall only accept for filing declarations of domestic partnership submitted by domestic partners who have residence in the city or who are employees of the city c amendments to the declaration a partner may amend a declaration of domestic partnership filed with the business license office at any time to show a change in such partners primary residence address d new declarations of domestic partnership no person who has created a domestic partnership may create another until twelve 12 months after a notice of termination has been signed and filed with the business license office  provided however that if the domestic partnership ended because of the death of the other party a new declaration may be filed any time after the notice of termination has been filed e evidence of domestic partnership any person who requires a person to provide evidence of the existence of a domestic partnership must accept the declaration of domestic partnership but may choose not to require the declaration as complete proof of the existence of a domestic partnership the declaration of domestic partnership may be considered reasonable proof for qualifying for any present or future domestic partner benefits that private corporations or public institutions offer  4405 records copies filing fees a records of the citys business office the clerk at the citys business license office shall keep a record of all declarations of domestic partnerships amendments to declarations of domestic partnership and all notices of termination the records shall be maintained so that amendments and notices of termination shall be filed with the declaration of domestic partnership to which they pertain b filing fees the business license office shall charge a fee of thirty dollars $3000 for the filing of a declaration of domestic partnership and shall charge a fee of $500 for providing certified copies of declarations amendments or notices of termination there will be no charge for the filing of amendments or notices of termination  4405 termination a termination a domestic partnership ends when 1 one partner sends the other partner written notice that such partner has ended the domestic partnership  2 one of the partners dies  or 3 the partners no longer meet one or more of the qualifications or conditions for domestic partnership b notice of termination 1 to domestic partners when a domestic partnership ends the partners must execute a notice of termination naming the partners and stating that the partnership has ended the notice of termination must be dated and signed under penalty of perjury by at least one of the partners the notice of termination must be filed with the business license office 2 to third parties a domestic partner who has given a copy of a declaration of domestic partnership to any third party in order to qualify for any benefit or right must whenever the domestic partnership ends give that third party a copy of the notice of termination if a partner has died the surviving partner must give notice of termination to those third parties such partner knows were given copies of the declaration by the deceased partner in order to qualify for a benefit or right the notice of termination must be sent to the parties identified in this section within sixty 60 days of the termination of the domestic partnership 3 failure to give notice failure to give notice as required by this chapter will neither prevent nor delay termination of the domestic partnership 4 termination by city notwithstanding any of the above the city shall terminate a domestic partnership if the city finds that the partners no longer meet one or more of the qualifications or conditions for domestic partnership the effective date of such termination will be retroactive to the date that such qualifications or conditions were no longer met  4405 enforcement a county or superior court any person may apply to the state court of fulton county or the superior court of fulton county or the appropriate courts for residents of city employees who live outside fulton county depending on jurisdictional requirements to the extent allowed by such courts for enforcement of the provisions of this article in law or equity b twoyear limit any action to enforce this chapter must be commenced no later than two 2 years after the claimed violation  4405 disclaimer despite any other provision nothing in this chapter shall require the city to provide insurance or benefits to resident domestic partners in which neither partner is an employee of the city this provision shall supersede any conflicting language or provision  4405 district a defined agricultural use and service tax district shall be an area determined by the city council to fall within this category and shall be predominated used and developed for agricultural purposes and the ancillary and necessary services in support thereof such agricultural uses shall include but not necessarily be limited to planting cultivation and growth of forests for timber pulpwood and other forest products dairy and beef cattle farm operations planting cultivation and harvesting of row crops and including growth cultivation and harvesting of hay use for the purposes of mining or quarrying of any type is excluded from agricultural use for the purposes of this section the predominant determination of this category shall be that the use and any and all products derived from such areas shall be a product of the land and earth upon which it is situated the ancillary and incidental uses thereto shall include residence of the owner or operator and living quarters of support personnel together with structures used directly in support of the predominant agricultural use such area because of its rural and predominant agricultural use shall require minimal police and fire services this classification shall be deemed to be abandoned when any additional development inconsistent with its predominant agricultural use is undertaken as may be evidenced by the request or furnishing of any of the following utility services including but not limited to sewage collection system water distribution system storm drainage system or additional read road installation any application for rezoning other than for agricultural use shall be prima facie evidence of abandonment of the agricultural use and service tax district b tax schedule 1 there shall be no ad valorem tax imposed by the city of east point upon land classified in the agricultural use and service tax district for the tax year commencing january 1 following the annexation of such area 2 commencing january 1 of the second year after annexation of any area within this classification there shall be imposed thereon an ad valorem tax as above stated equivalent to twentyfive 25 percent of the millage applicable to full service tax districts of the city of east point 3 commencing january 1 of the third year after annexation of any area within this classification there shall be imposed thereon an ad valorem tax as above stated equivalent to forty 40 percent of the millage applicable to full service tax districts of the city of east point 4 commencing january 1 of the fourth year after annexation of any area within this classification there shall be imposed thereon an ad valorem tax as above stated equivalent to fifty 50 percent of the millage applicable to full service tax districts of the city of east point and continuing at this level from year to year thereafter until termination of the agricultural use and service tax district 2 developmental use and service tax district a defined developmental use and service tax district shall be any area annexed to the city of east point which has been or becomes transitional from a predominant rural and agricultural use to development for residential commercial or industrial usage for the purposes of determining developmental classification it shall be conclusively presumed to be developmental unless already in use for residential commercial or industrial use when there is filed an application for rezoning for other than agricultural use or utility services of water distribution sewage collection storm sewer drainage or street improvements are permitted and installed upon such property b tax schedule 1 for developmental use and service tax districts so defined upon annexation the ad valorem tax assessment on such property shall be zero percentage of the city millage for the first year commencing on january 1 after its annexation 2 on january 1 after becoming classified as developmental use from agricultural use and service tax districts or the second year after annexation and so classified upon annexation the ad valorem tax imposition against such property shall be fifty 50 percent of the millage imposed upon all full service tax districts of the city 3 on january 1 of the second year after becoming classified as developmental use from agricultural use and service tax districts or the third year after annexation and so classified upon annexation the ad valorem tax imposition against such property shall be seventyfive 75 percent of the millage imposed upon all full service tax districts of the city 4 on january 1 of the third year after becoming classified as developmental use from agricultural use and service tax districts or the fourth year after annexation and so classified upon annexation the ad valorem tax imposition against such property shall be one hundred 100 percent of the millage imposed upon all full service tax districts of the city 3 full service tax district a defined a full service tax district shall consist of all other properties of the city of east point except agricultural use and service tax districts and developmental use and service tax districts developed for residential commercial or industrial usage b tax schedule on and after january 1 of the year after annexation all property not meeting the two 2 preceding categories shall have imposed thereon one hundred 100 percent of the citywide tax millage    91878 failure to file returns if any person fails refuses or for any reason neglects to make or file a tax return covering real estate or personal 72092 appeals from assessed valuations  generally a any taxpayer feeling aggrieved at the assessment of his real or personal property may file a petition with the mayor and council setting forth under oath all the property real and personal owned by the taxpayer and subject to taxation by the city at its true market value as well as giving the assessment thereon by the director of finance whereupon the mayor and council shall have a hearing thereon after giving notice of the time and place of the hearing to the petitioner as well as to the director of finance at the same time and place the mayor and council shall investigate all the facts relating to the taxpayers return and after the investigation shall order the same reduced raised or approved as they may find to be just fair and reasonable and these findings shall thereupon be held final for the year for which the assessments were made at such hearings the mayor and council may require the production of books papers or records necessary for a full investigation they shall also have power and authority to issue subpoena duces tecum to any taxpayer requiring production of all his books papers policies etc in order that the true values may be ascertained b on the hearing of an appeal by a taxpayer against the assessment of his property by the director of finance the mayor and council acting chairman may issue subpoenas requiring the attendance of any person on the hearing of the appeal and may at the hearing swear them as witnesses and secure from them all facts of which the witnesses may have knowledge c any person subpoenaed before the mayor and council or director of finance either to appear in person or to bring documents who refuses to attend as required by the subpoena or who afterwards declines to answer questions pertinent to the issue or who declines to produce the documents or paper required by the subpoena duces tecum shall be guilty of an offense  72092 sametime of filing all requests or appeals to the occupied by such resident if such residents adjusted gross income together with the adjusted gross income of the residents spouse who also resides at such homestead does not exceed the maximum amount which may be received by an individual and an individuals spouse under the federal social security act as used in this subsection the term adjusted gross income shall have the same meaning as defined in the united states internal revenue except that for the purposes of this subsection the term shall include only that portion of income or benefits received as retirement survivor or disability benefits under the federal social security act or under any other public or private retirement disability or pension system which exceeds the maximum amount which may be received by an individual and an individuals spouse under the federal social security act the homestead exemption provided for in this section shall not apply to any state or county ad valorem taxes or to any ad valorem taxes levied for the fulton county school district b in order to qualify for the exemption provided for in subsection a of this section as being disabled the person claiming such exemption shall be required to obtain a certificate from not less than three 3 physicians licensed to practice medicine under state law relative to medical practitioners as now or hereafter amended certifying that in the opinion of such physician or physicians such person is mentally or physically incapacitated to the extent that such person is unable to be gainfully employed and that such incapacity is likely to be permanent c a person shall not receive the homestead exemption granted by subsection a of this section unless the person or persons agent files an affidavit with the tax commissioner of the city of east point giving the persons age or if disabled the certificate or certificates required by subsection b of this section and the amount of income which the person and the persons spouse received during the last taxable year for income tax purposes and such additional information relative to receiving such exemption as will enable the tax commissioner to make a determination as to whether such owner is entitled to such exemption the tax commissioner shall provide affidavit forms for this purpose d after a person has filed the proper affidavit and certificate or certificates if disabled as provided in subsections b and c of this section it shall not be necessary to make application and file the said affidavit and certificate thereafter for any year and the exemption shall continue to be allowed to such person it shall be the duty of any such person however to notify the tax commissioner in the event such person becomes ineligible for any reason to receive the homestead exemption granted by this section e the homestead exemption granted by this section shall be cumulative of any other homestead exemption applicable to city of east point ad valorem taxes the homestead exemption granted by definitions the following words terms and phrases shall for the purposes of this article and except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning be defined as follows a rental charge means the total value received by a rental motor vehicle concern for the rental or lease for thirtyone 31 or fewer consecutive days of a rental motor vehicle including the total cash and nonmonetary consideration for the rental or lease including but not limited to charges based on time or mileage and charges for insurance coverage or collision damage waiver but excluding all charges for motor fuel taxes or sales taxes b rentalmotor vehicle means a motor vehicle designed to carry ten 10 or fewer passengers and used primarily for the transportation of persons that is rented or leased without a driver regardless of whether such vehicle is licensed in this state c rental motor vehicle concern means a person or legal entity which owns or leases five 5 or more rental motor vehicles and which regularly rents or leases such vehicles to the public for value  1697 levy of tax there is hereby imposed and levied a tax of three 3 percent upon the rental charge collected by a rental motor vehicle concern when such charge constitutes a taxable event for purposes of sales and use tax under of of title 48 of the official georgia annotated the tax is imposed only at the time when and place within the city where a customer pays sales tax with respect to the rental charge the customer who pays a rental charge that is subject to the tax levied by this article shall be liable for the tax the tax shall be paid by the customer to the rental motor vehicle concern the tax shall be a debt of the customer to the rental motor vehicle concern until it is paid and shall be recoverable at law in the same manner as authorized for the recovery of other debts the rental motor vehicle concern collecting the tax shall remit the tax to the city and the tax remitted shall be a credit against the tax imposed on the rental motor vehicle concern every rental motor vehicle concern subject to tax shall be liable for the tax at the applicable rate on the charges actually collected or the amount of tax collected from customers whichever is greater  1697 exemption no tax shall be imposed under this article on the rental charge associated with the rental or lease of a rental motor vehicle if either 1 the customer picks up the rental motor vehicle outside this state and returns it in this state  or 2 the customer picks up the rental motor vehicle in this state and returns it outside this state tax the person against whom the entry was made shall not be allowed or entitled to have or collect any fees or charges whatsoever for services rendered after the entry of the nulla bona if at any time specifications and the contract shall be awarded to the lowest and best bidder  provided the city shall have the right to reject any or all bids  and provided further that nothing in this section shall be construed to prevent the authorities in charge of any city building from performing any such branches of work by or regular employees or in the case of public institutions by inmates thereof
