note  2 adopted  amended former ch 6 arts ad in its entirety which pertained to similar subject matter and derived from the the following  41679   71789  86   71894 article a  general provisions east point chief of police  duties and responsibilities a the east point chief of police shall be the chief law enforcement officer for the city of east point georgia as provided for in charter and related local laws section 1104 specific powers nos 32 40 and in the georgia laws the east point police chief shall meet requirements of ocga 35810 certification requirements for state peace officer license b the chief of police shall meet the requirements of ocga 3588 concerning the hiring requirements for peace officers for the state of georgia the east point police chief shall also meet the requirements of ocga 35820 to 358201special training for police chiefs and ocga 3 5821annual training required for peace officers c the east point chief of police shall promulgate written standard operating procedures sop for all personnel assigned to the police department these rules regulations and procedures shall govern the conduct efficiency effectiveness operation responsiveness discipline and delivery of services for the police department each employee assigned to the police department shall have a copy and be responsible for the contents of the standard operating procedure sop the standard operating procedure sop will be updated and revised by the police chief and staff as needed a copy of the standard operating procedure sopshall be on file with the mayor and city council violations of the standard operating procedures sop rules or regulations may be grounds for reprimand transfer from current position or department demotion suspension or termination d the chief of police or his designee shall administer the oath of office to all sworn police officers detention officers and communication officers as agents for the city to enforce all laws e the chief of police shall have full responsibility and in charge of space utilization of the law enforcement building this responsibility will be for all departments police department jail court communications and any other group assigned to the law enforcement center no changes modifications or painting shall be made to the building without approval of the chief of police  4599 administrative staff the chief of police shall assemble an administrative staff to assist in operations and administrative services of the police department  4599 requirements for police officers police applicants must meet the following requirements for employment with the police department and for state certification as stated in part of ocga 3588 and georgia post rules  applicants must be twentyone 21 years of age must have a valid georgia drivers license no felony convictions no duis no significant number of misdemeanors as to reflect a disregard for traffic laws honorable discharge if prior military service must be a united states citizen possess a high school diploma or state certified ged must not have been terminated from previous police job or asked to resign for accusation of any misconduct or conduct must become a georgia resident must furnish copy of post certification peace officer number must pass written entry level police test must pass polygraph testing must pass medical and drug testing must pass post police entry level test and complete thorough background and interview process  4599 hiring pay steps noncertified police officer hires are to be hired at entry level step one of the current pay plan in effect when they do not have a twoyear accredited college degree the chief of police has the authority to hire prior post certified police officers with two years of police experience and training at step two in the current pay plan the chief of police shall also have the authority to hire previous post certified police officers that have previously worked for the east point police department at step two in the current pay plan in effect after completing the required probationary period all above hires shall be moved to the next step  4599 police department organization the chief of police has the authority to organize the police department into divisions within the department and to assign and transfer personnel which would best correspond with the needs of the department residents of the city of east point and the city government  4599 familiarization with standard operating procedure sop every employee shall be furnished with a copy of the standard operating procedure sop governing the police department and shall thoroughly familiarize themselves with the rules and regulations ignorance of any rule or regulation contained in the sop shall not be an excuse to an officer that is charged with a violation of the same each employee shall keep their sop up to date at all times revisions or updates shall be given out when necessary failure to keep sops up to date or produce the manual when notified shall be cause for suspension violations of the standard operating procedure sop are covered by policy a060 unless specifically covered in this or other chapters of the city  4599 demeanor and conduct of officersemployees each officeremployee shall conduct themselves in a quiet civil and orderly manner at all times officersemployees shall maintain decorum attention control of temper patience discretion and must refrain from harsh violent coarse profane or insolent language officersemployees shall not answer in a short abrupt manner and shall not be biased in their decisions all answers shall be with courtesy respect and attention proper respect shall be shown at all times to the public other officers to the ranking system in the police department violations of this section may result in suspension or dismissal  4599 required devotion to duty police officersemployees shall devote their entire working time and attention to the business of the police department city and public all officers and employees of the department are subject to be responsive to calls for service and must act immediately on notice that their services are required all officersemployees must work their regular hours or return to work when properly notified all officersemployees shall have correct uniforms and equipment when working on or off duty violations of this section may result in suspension or dismissal  4599 acceptance of gratuitiesmaking bail bonds no officeremployee shall directly or indirectly recommend or suggest to any person arrested or to any prisoner in custody the employment hire of any specific attorney or bail bondsman no officeremployee shall become a surety or grantor or go on the bond of or furnish bail for any person arrested and charged with a crime except members of their immediate family no officeremployee shall accept from any person any gratuity reward gift or other compensation for services rendered or for expenses incurred in connection with official duties violations for this section may result in suspension or dismissal  4599 discharge of officersemployees  conductmisconduct any officer or employee shall be discharged from the city andor police department for cause shown after a hearing and conviction for a failure to discharge their duties or for any conduct unbecoming of a police officeremployee or for any misconduct while on or off duty any officer or employee discharged for above offenses shall have five 5 business days on which to file a written notice of appeal after they have received written notice of such discharge appeals are regulated by section 41012 appeals of the city  4599 compliance with lawful just and legal orders all officersemployees of the police department shall promptly execute the lawful just and legal orders or instructions of a supervisor violations of this section shall result in suspension to dismissal depending upon the circumstances  4599 relief from dutywork hours the chief of police has the authority to set work hours for all police officers and other employees of the police department all personnel shall remain on duty until relieved in situations where an officer or other employee must be sent home for cause and the chief of police is not available watch commanders are authorized to send an officer or employee home for one 1 day and to have employee report to the chief of police on the next day  4599 dissemination of protected information information should not be given out that would interfere with the successful conclusion of an investigation pose a security threat violate federal state or city laws or privacy laws that is detrimental or defeats the ends of justice prejudicial to the rights of the suspect accused or employee  that will impact on the dignity of the department or personnel background information on police applicants or other employees are confidential and are also covered by this section violations of this section shall result in suspension to dismissal  4599 treatment of arrested persons police officers shall not mistreat or use be medically treated as expedient as possible violations of this section shall result in suspension to dismissal  4599 uniformspolice vehiclesequipment the chief of police shall devise professional shall be judged of by the mayor city council and city manager who shall have power to remove him from office in accordance with the provisions of the charter and related laws duties and responsibilities of the chief of the fire department a the fire chief of the city of east point shall be the chief authority over emergency management and fire rescue in the city of east point the fire chief is responsible for managing the prevention and suppression of fire  delivering emergency medical services  managing and coordinating the fire department administration and operations sections in order to protect life and property  enforcing all city fire codes ordinances and fire laws and regulations of the state  ensuring that the work of all department employees is monitored  establishing and monitoring procedures for firefighting prefire planning non fire hazards medical emergencies or other emergencies  overseeing the hiring promotions and termination processes investigating internal and external complaints and working to enhance the effectiveness and efficiency of fire protection b the fire chief shall ensure that the city manager remains current and abreast of all major policies affecting the administration of the department and other city departments regarding major fire policies services or business attend meetings and present reports to the city manager mayor city council and other committees commissions and groups as requested c the fire chief is responsible for preparing and implementing management plans and strategic plans for all areas of fire department including prevention homeland security rescuemedical station relocation etc d the fire chief shall establish rules and regulations standard operating procedures controls and disciplines for the department in accordance with applicable rules regulations city policy city ordinances state and federal law e the fire chief will supervise direct and evaluate assigned staff  handle employee concerns and problems  direct work counsel discipline and evaluate fire department employees in firefighting prefire planning hazardous material emergencies rescue operations and other related emergencies f the fire chief shall coordinate mutual fire protection plans with surrounding municipalities  establish ongoing meetings with other fire and police departments and other agencies to stay abreast of homeland security strengths weaknesses and threats  11607 three platoon system established a the fire chief or the chiefs designee has the authority to set work hours for all fire 11607 notifying the fire department a whenever an unfriendly fire occurs in any building or on any premises of any kind the owner manager occupant or any person in control of such building or premises upon discovery of an unfriendly fire or evidence of there having been an unfriendly fire even though it has apparently been extinguished shall immediately notify the fire department of such fire whether the fire has been extinguished or not this requirements shall not be construed to forbid the owner manager or other person in control of the aforementioned building or premises from using all diligence necessary to extinguish such fire prior to the arrival of the fire department b no person shall make issue post or maintain any regulation or order written or verbal that would require any person to take any action that would delay notifying the fire department of a fire  7 11607 mutual aid the fire chief at the chiefs discretion may make available for duty employees property or dangerous and hazardous object 5 of the code be and is hereby stricken in its entirety and the following section inserted in lieu thereof blasting permits and bond required for blasting before a permit to do blasting as required under section 123a3 shall be issued according to the rules and procedures delineated below blasting permits any person firm corporation partnership or contractor wishing to engage in the use of explosives or blasting within the limits of the city of east point first obtain a permit therefor preliminary permit for such preliminary blasting permit anyone seeking same shall first post a bond or a certified copy of a liability insurance policy in the minimum amount of $50000 property damage per individual per occurrence $100000 aggregate property damage per occurrence and $300000 bodily injury per person per occurrence with an aggregate bodily injury of $300000 per occurrence or in such additional amount as may be deemed necessary by the fire chief said bond or insurance policy shall be in a form payable for any damages arising from such preliminary test explosions and all damages arising from subsequent blasting operations if the production blasting permit issues before commencing initial test explosions a survey shall be conducted of all structures where permitted by owner contiguous to the blasting area and also other structures possibly endangered based on location andor condition color photographs are to be taken of typical conditions in each structure to reflect its condition prior to blasting all exposed structures shall be carefully protected from the effects of the blasts and all blasts shall be covered with blasting mats dirt heavy timbers or other suitable material the blasting shall be done by experienced workmen any damage done shall be promptly repaired by the contractor at his own expense all blasting supplies shall be stored in a manner approved by the state fire marshal and a watchman shall be stationed at all times at the place of the storage care shall be taken for the initial test explosions and all subsequent explosions to minimize ground vibrations with a maximum peak particle velocity as measured at the nearest structure not to exceed 20 inches per second the over pressure noise or concussion shall be minimized and sufficient stemming and matting used to prevent over pressure in excess of 120 db precaution shall be taken to minimize flying rock and sufficient matting used to prevent rocks from striking any person or structure the preliminary permit shall be issued for the purposes of making initial test explosions at which time vibration recording instruments shall be used on the initial test explosions and all others deemed necessary to determine proper blasting procedures these instruments shall be of the type which records on directreading tape the three 3 components of velocity the analysis of these recordings are to be signed by a registered professional engineer licensed in the state of georgia the tapes and all other recorded documentary information are to be filed with the fire department at the time of making application for the blasting permit blasting is not to be conducted which will produce a scale distance less than previously recorded for at least three 3 different explosions deemed to be safe the scale distance is to be determined by the distance from the shot to the nearest structure subject to potential damage from ground vibrations overpressure concussion is to be recorded on a direct recording tape preferably at the same recording as the vibration the instrument used for measuring concussion shall be the type specifically designed for impact type overpressure from explosions for initial test shots under the preliminary blasting permits care shall be taken to assure that ground vibrations with a maximum peak particle velocity as measured at the nearest structure do not exceed 10 inches per second in the initial testing phase of explosion or blasting operations prior to instrumentation a scale distance of fifty 50 for residential structures and a scale distance of twentyfive 25 for commercial and engineered structures or numerically greater may be used to determine the maximum charge weight per delay interval of seventeen milliseconds or greater note a commercial or engineered structure to qualify for the scaled distance limitation of twentyfive 25 under the above regulation is one in which the load bearing frame is of steel or reinforced concrete with no inclusions of wall or ceilings for residential type construction ie plastic walls or ceilings supported by studs or joist or rafters of wood commonly associated with what is commonly known as carpenter construction all scale distance and blasting shall conform with standards and formulations set forth in table 1 attached hereto all blast testing vibration and seismographic equipment shall conform to the standards and procedures set forth in table 2 attached hereto and which is by reference incorporated herein and made a part hereof for preliminary testing blasting and all production blasting records shall be maintained in conformance with the information required on table 3 attached hereto and which is by reference incorporated herein and made a part hereof all blasting whether preliminary testing or production blasting shall conform with the safety standards set forth on table 4 attached hereto and which is by reference incorporated herein and made a part hereof upon completion of tests blasting and after certification by an engineer it shall be submitted to the fire department of the city of east point for approval and issuance of a production blasting permit and setting of a bond andor liability insurance policy it is required before the issuance of a production blasting permit that said bond or certified copy of liability blasting insurance be filed with the fire chief of the city of east point said bond or blasting liability insurance policy shall on its face become payable for payment for any damages arising from such permitted blasting upon furnishing of all of said items and establishment of the amount of the bond or blasting liability insurance policy the fire chief of the city of east point shall issue a production blasting permit table 1 definitions 1 scaled distance is defined as the product obtained by dividing the distance in feet to the nearest building structure by the square root of the weight of explosive per time delay in pounds 2 blaster is any person who engaging in a blasting operation decides hole size spacing or depth  decides total quantity of explosive  decides quantity of explosive in each hole  andor decides timing delays to be used such person must be present when the charge is detonated and either physically detonates the charge or gives the order to detonate the charge blasting standards a in all blasting operations except as hereinafter otherwise provided the maximum peak particle velocity of the ground motion in any direction shall not exceed two inches per second at the immediate location of any dwelling house public building school church commercial or institutional building b this ground velocity limit is not construed to mean on property owned leased or contracted by the blaster or blasters company or on property on which the owner gives a written waiver c no two consecutive subcharges within any charge shall be separated by a time delay of less than seventeen milliseconds d the standard table for the maximum charge per delay period shall be for distances greater than 300 feet generated by the following formula w   d  50  2 where w is the weight of explosive in lbs and d is the distance to the nearest dwelling house public building school church commercial or institutional building in feet on sites where the city decides it necessary to comply with the provisions of the law this formula may be altered e for the purpose of well shooting below 100 feet  the table shall be generated by the following formula w   d  50  3 where w is the total weight of explosives in the hole and d is the distance from the charge to the nearest dwelling house public building school church commercial institutional building f if on a particular site the peak ground particle continuously exceeds  inch per second after a period of one 1 second following the maximum ground particle velocity the city shall require the total time delay of blasting operations to be less than 200 milliseconds or the charge per delay be reduced so that this limit is complied with g for distances less than 300 feet the following table shall be used actual distance in feet pounds per delay interval of 8 milliseconds or greater 510 18 lb 1115  lb 1620  lb 2125  lb 2630 10 lb 31300 1 lb + 18 lb for each foot of distance above 30 feet less than 5 feet the total charge should not exceed 18 lb table 2 testing equipment a if a blaster decides that the table provided by the city is too conservative or limiting he may on 15 days notification to the department of mines and minerals use seismograph measurements and increase the charge per delay period provided the velocity of 2 inches per second limit is not violated he must use the seismograph on every shot thereafter so long as the table is not being complied with if the blaster decides to return to the use of the table he may do so by notifying the department 15 days in advance b if a blaster considers the table too limiting or too conservative for his particular area he may upon submission of seismograph reports petition for a modified table for blasting operation at that particular site but in no case shall the department allow a table that would permit velocities above the 2 inch per second limit c in making a seismograph determination of the velocity at a particular position the following formula shall be used v   v o d<inf>o<inf>  d 15 where v o is the maximum ground particle velocity at the seismograph d o is the distance from the blast and d is the distance from the blast to the position in question and in the same general direction the distance d o may not be greater than d and d cannot be more than five 5 times d o  this determined velocity at the site of any dwelling house public building school church commercial or institutional building shall not exceed the two 2 inches per second limit d in seismic tests for compliance or petition the analysis of seismic data shall be conducted by a completely independent company one not related to the company performing the blasting or for whom the blasting is being performed under the direction of a professional engineer registered in georgia e a direct reading velocity instrument shall be approved only if it has a frequency range of 5 cycles per second to 150 cycles per second or greater a velocity range from zero to 20 insec or greater adheres to design criteria for portable seismographs as outlined in usbm ri5708 usbm ri6487 f instruments of both the direct reading velocity type and the displacement type are approved for use as follows 1 particle velocity reading may be calculated from results obtained by a displacement instrument or obtained from an approved direct reading velocity instrument in any blasting operation where all of the following conditions exist a recording distance is over 200 feet from the blast  b scaled distance is numerically greater than 25  c frequency range is 40 cycles per second or less 2 a direct reading velocity instrument will be required in any blasting operation where all of the following conditions exist a recording distance is less than 200 feet  from the blast  b scaled distance is numerically less than 50 3 a direct reading velocity instrument will be required in any blasting operation where all the following conditions exist a recording distance is more than 200 feet  from the blast  b scaled distance is numerically less than 25 4 a direct reading velocity instrument will be required in any blasting operation where all of the following conditions exist a recording distance is more than 200 feet  from the blast  b frequency range is in excess of 40 cycles per second scaled distance is defined as d subsub  <sqrt  d  w> where d is the actual distance in feet and w is the weight of explosives in pounds per delay period of seventeen milliseconds or greater table 3 records a record of each blast shall be kept all records including seismograph reports shall be retained at least two years and shall be available for inspection by the city and shall contain the following minimum data 1 name of company or contractor 2 location date and time of blast 3 name signature and license number of blaster in charge 4 type of material blasted 5 number of holes burden and spacing 6 diameter and depth of holes 7 types of explosives used 8 total amount of explosives used 9 maximum amount of explosives per delay period of eight 8 milliseconds or greater 10 method of firing and type of circuit 11 direction and distance in feet to nearest dwelling house public building school church commercial or institutional building neither owned nor leased by the person conducting the blasting 12 weather conditions 13 type and height or length of stemming 14 if mats or other protections were used 15 type of delay electric blasting caps used and delay periods used 16 the person taking the seismograph reading shall accurately indicate exact location of seismograph if used and shall also show the distance of seismograph from blast 17 seismograph records where required a name of person and firm analyzing the seismograph record 18 maximum number of holes per delay period of seventeen 17 milliseconds or greater table 4 safety standards a when blasting operations other than those conducted at a fixed site as a part of any industry or business operated at such site are to be conducted within two hundred feet of a pipe line the blaster or person in charge of the blasting operations shall take due precautionary measures for the protection of the line and shall notify the owner of the line or his agent that such blasting operations are intended b blasting operations near streams shall be prohibited in all cases where the effect of the blasting is liable to change the course or channel of any stream without first obtaining a permit from the department which has been approved by the division of water in the department of natural resources c mudcapping in blasting operations shall be permitted only where it would endanger the safety of the workmen to drill the rock or material to be blasted if mudcapping is necessary no more than ten pounds of explosives shall be used for each charge d all trunk lines of detonating cord may be covered except that trunk lines of detonating cord must be covered if located within eight hundred feet of any public highway dwelling house public building school church commercial or institutional building e in blasting operation flying rocks shall not be allowed to fall greater than onehalf the distance between the blast and a dwelling house public building school church commercial or institutional building protective material should be used to insure this limit f when operating within 800 feet of a highway if there is chance of flying rock landing on the highway traffic must be stopped at a safe distance blasted material shall not be thrown on a public highway in sufficient quantity to impede traffic and any material thrown on a highway must be removed promptly g the contractor or operator as well as the blaster shall be responsible for the conduct of blasting on any operation h these regulations are in no way intended to relieve the contractor or operator or other persons or responsibility and liability under any other laws 6 general requirements of the east point fire prevention hereby amended by adding a new remaining below the end of the suction pipe can be pumped out with a pitcher pump suction hose inserted in the fill opening water is then introduced into the fill pipe of the tank and is permitted to overflow the fill pipe for some time so that the remaining gasoline which is lighter than water will be washed away the water level should be such as to insure that all parts of the tank are filled with water periodic inspections should be made to insure that water is kept at the proper level as loss may occur due to evaporation or leakage after each inspection the fill cap and any other opening cover except the vent should be locked or screwed down tight when the use of any tank is discontinued for more than twelve 12 months it shall be considered permanently abandoned and must be removed 10 fire general is hereby amended by adding a new section to be numbered 2817 2818 2819 2820 and to read as follows tar heating equipment it is hereby prohibited for any person firm or corporation to heat tar asphalt pitch or other combustible material in on or within fifty 50 feet of any building structure combustible material or substance for roofing weatherproofing waterproofing or insulation purposes except in conformance with the following safety requirements a the fire prevention bureau shall be notified before any kettle or other container used for heating the above mentioned materials shall be placed in on or within fifty 50 feet of any building structure combustible material or substance and no such kettle or heating equipment shall be operated within any building except by the written permission of the chief of fire prevention bureau of the city of east point b there shall be a kettle operator experienced with the equipment involved familiar with the fire hazards the precautions to be observed and the use of fire extinguishing facilities required in attendance at the kettle at all times the kettle is being fired or heated and so remain until the temperature of the kettle and its contents does not exceed three hundred fifty 350 degrees fahrenheit as may be determined by a thermometer which shall be provided and maintained at or near the kettle at all times c there shall be at all times at or near the kettle and readily accessible to the operator one approved class b fire extinguisher with a minimum rating that equals or exceeds the class b hazard at least one 20 b rated approved fire extinguisher d not more than six hundred 600 pounds of combustible material or substance to be heated shall be stored within twentyfive 25 feet of any kettle while same is in operation e no kettle using flammable liquid for fuel shall be refueled while in operation and any flammable liquid placed within twentyfive 25 feet of a kettle shall be stored in an approved safety container which shall be kept sealed or closed at all times the kettle is in operation f no mop or other applicator which has been used or submerged in tar pitch asphalt or other combustible material or substance in the process of applying roofing weatherproofing waterproofing or insulation shall be left overnight in on or within twentyfive 25 feet of any building structure or combustible material or substance g fired roofing kettles shall not be operated on roofs of buildings h all improved streets shall be protected from burning by use of sand and other noncombustible materials under roofing kettles streets shall be cleaned of all excess tar and other debris upon completion of work i no person shall use solid fuel or class i flammable liquids as fuel for a roofing kettle j compressed and liquefied gases shall be stored handled transported and used in accordance with applicable provisions of nfpa codes and standards storage and handling of compressed and liquefied gases not covered by nfpa codes and standards shall comply with applicable provisions of standards of the american national standards institute ansi  federal regulations title 49 parts 173 transportation  pressure vessels of the american society of mechanical engineers boiler and pressure vessel container fabrication  or the container fabrication specifications of the american petroleum institute 16 fire prevention department no permit shall be issued until a site inspection is performed the weather and wind conditions must be deemed as safe this permit will require authorization from the fire chief or the chiefs designee commercial burning shall be performed in pits with air curtain destructors for the purpose of land clearing all pit fires shall be operated in strict accordance with the air curtain destructor operating guide and procedures published by the north georgia region on environmental protection division pit fires shall comply with the following requirements 1 the pit shall be at least three hundred 300 feet from any structure or public road air curtain destructors acd used solely for utility line clearing or road clearing may be located at a lesser distance upon approval of the fire chief or hisher designee 2 only wood wastes consisting of trees logs brush and stumps may be burned sawdust or other densely packed wood wastes paper any type chemically treated coated or impregnated wood or nonwood construction materials cannot be burned 3 no more than one 1 acd can be operated within a ten 10 acre area at one time or there must be at least one thousand 1000 feet between any twoair curtain destructors the air curtain destructor must be under control of a trained operator at all times during operation 4 air curtain destructor must be able to pass an even nonturbulent flow of air across the top of the pit air curtain destructors with an air duct or manifold that has been altered by bends dents holes etc and are incapable of providing an even and nonturbulent flow of air across the top of the pit shall not be approved for use 5 the air curtain destructor shall be operated in a manner to prevent air land or water pollution safetyhealth hazards or nuisances 6 tires or other rubber products plastics heavy oils or asphaltedbased or impregnated materials shall not be used to start or maintain the operation of the air curtain destructors 7 no smoke emissions exceeding forty 40 percent capacity may be produced during operations except for a reasonable period during ignition and charging of the pit 8 when the pit is cleaned of ash airborne particulates are to be minimized by wetting or mixing the ashes with dirt 9 diesel fuel for kerosene may be used to start pit fires  11607 removal of dangerous and hazardous containers no automobile premises from the outside and free of unsanitary conditions and any of the foregoing shall be promptly removed and abated by the owner or operator it shall be the duty of the owner or operator to keep inoperative machinery  2 dead and dying trees tree limbs and decorative landscaping specifically installed  3 loose and overhanging objects which by reason of location above ground level constitute a areas and other parts of the premises  5 inadequate runoff drains for storm waters  and 6 sources of infestation b the exterior of the premises and the condition of necessary structures shall be maintained so that the premises and all buildings thereon shall reflect a level of maintenance in keeping with the standards of the neighborhood and such that the premises and structures shall not constitute a blighting factor for adjoining property owners nor an element leading to the progressive deterioration and downgrading of the neighborhood including the following 1 foundations floors and walls which are not structurally sound  2 chimneys and flue vent attachments which are not safe durable smoke tight and capable of withstanding the action of flue gasses  3 exterior porches landings balconies stairs and fire escapes which are not provided with banisters or railings properly designed installed and maintained to minimize the hazard of falling  4 all permanent signs and billboards paint has excessively peeled or cracked or those whose supporting members have deteriorated so that they no longer meet the structural requirements of the building code shall with their supporting members be removed or put into a good state of repair all nonoperative or broken electrical signs shall be repaired or shall with their supporting members be removed  5 all store fronts and walls exposed to public view shall be kept in a good state of repair  6 any awning or marquee and its accompanying structural members shall be maintained in a good state of repair in the event said awnings disperse the contents of or otherwise vandalize any containers provided by any county or city for the dumping of solid waste  secs 7202772050  reserved article b  litter division 1  generally purpose and intent the purpose of this article is to protect the public health safety environment and general welfare regulation and prevention of litter the objectives of this ordinance are 1 provide for uniform prohibition throughout the city of east point of any and all littering on public or private property  and 2 prevent the desecration of the beauty and quality of life of the city and prevent harm to the public health safety environment and general welfare including the degradation of water and aquatic resources caused by litter 1 121906 applicability this article shall apply to all public and private property within the city of east point 2 121906 compatibility with other regulations the requirements of this article should be considered minimum requirements and where any provision of this article imposes restrictions different from those imposed by any other ordinance rule or regulation or other provision of law whichever provisions are more restrictive or impose higher protective standards for human health or the environment shall be considered to take precedence 3 121906 severability if the provisions of any article section subsection paragraph subdivision or clause of this article shall be judged invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction such order of judgment shall not affect or invalidate the remainder of any article section subsection paragraph subdivision or clause of this article 4 121906 definitions litter means any organic or inorganic waste material rubbish refuse garbage trash hulls peelings debris grass weeds ashes sand gravel slag brickbats metal plastic and glass containers broken glass dead animals discarded construction materials abandoned construction materials or intentionally or unintentionally discarded materials of every kind and description which are not waste as such term is defined in ocga  16751 paragraph 6 person means any individual including both landlords and tenants partnership firm association joint venture public or private corporation trust estate commission board public or private institution utility cooperative city county or other political subdivision of the state any interstate body or any other legal entity public or private property means the right of way of any road or highway  any body of water or watercourse or the shores or beaches thereof any park playground building refuge or conservation or recreation area  timberlands or forests  and residential commercial industrial or farm properties  121906 secs 7205672070  reserved division 2  prohibitions violations enforcement and penalties prohibition against littering public or private property or waters it shall be unlawful for any person or persons to dump deposit throw or leave or to cause or permit the dumping depositing placing throwing or leaving of litter on any public or private property in the city of east point or any waters in the city unless 1 the property is designated by the state or by any of its agencies or political subdivisions for the disposal of such litter and such person is authorized by the proper public authority to use such property  2 the litter is placed into a receptacle or container installed on such property  3 the person is the owner or tenant in lawful possession of such property or has first obtained consent of the owner or tenant in lawful possession or unless the act is done under the personal direction of the owner or tenant all in a manner consistent with the public welfare  or 4 the materials or condition otherwise subject to enforcement under this article are the direct and immediate result of the removal and deposit of a tenants personal property in the course of a lawful eviction  121906 vehicle loads causing litter no person shall operate any motor vehicle with a load on or in such vehicle unless the load on or in such vehicle is adequately secured to prevent the dropping or shifting of materials from such load onto the roadway  121906 violations it shall be unlawful for any person to violate any provision or fail to comply with any of the requirements of this article any person who has violated or continues to violate the provisions of this article may be subject to the enforcement actions outlined in this division or may be restrained by injunction or otherwise sentenced in a manner provided by law where the violation occurs on rental property either the landlord or tenant or both may be held responsible for such violation 1 121906 evidence a whenever litter is thrown deposited dropped or dumped from any motor vehicle boat airplane or other conveyance in violation of this article it shall be prima facie evidence that the operator of the conveyance has violated this article however the lawful distribution of newsletters political publications religious publications and other written communications shall not constitute litter b except as provided in subsection a whenever any litter which is dumped deposited thrown or left on public or private property in violation of this article is discovered to contain any article or articles not easily obtainable in the public domain including but not limited to letters bills publications or other writing which display the name of the person thereon in such a manner as to indicate that the article belongs or belonged to such person it shall be a rebuttable presumption that such person has violated this article 2 121906 penalties any person who violates this article shall be guilty of a violation and upon conviction thereof shall be punished as follows 1 by a fine of not less than two hundred dollars $20000 and not more than one thousand two hundred dollars $120000  and 2 in addition to the fine set out in subsection a above the violator shall reimburse the city for the reasonable cost of removing the litter when the litter is or is ordered removed by the city  and 3 a in the sound discretion of the municipal court the person may be directed to pick up and remove from any public street or highway or public rightof way for a distance not to exceed one mile any litter he has deposited and any and all litter deposited thereon by anyone else prior to the date of execution of sentence  or b in the sound discretion of the municipal court the person may be directed to pick up and remove any and all litter from any public property private rightofway or with prior permission of the legal owner or tenant in lawful possession of such property any private property upon which it can be established by competent evidence that he has deposited litter pick up and removal shall include any and all litter deposited thereon by anyone prior to the date of execution of sentence  and 4 the court may publish the names of persons convicted of violating this article 3 121906 enforcement all law enforcement agencies officers and officials of this state and the city of east point are hereby authorized empowered and directed to enforce compliance with this article 4 or other domestic animals shall be provided to protect such creatures against inclement weather and extreme temperatures    8105 bird sanctuary city designated as such  molesting or killing birds in any manner any bird or wild fowl or to rob bird nests or wild fowl nests  provided however if starlings or similar birds are found to be congregating in such numbers in a particular locality that they constitute a nuisance or a menace to health or property in the opinion of the proper health authorities of the city the health authorities shall meet with representatives of the audubon society bird club garden club or humane society or as many of such clubs as are to be found to exist in the city after having given at least three 3 days actual notice of the time and place of such meeting to the representatives of such clubs c if as a result of such meeting no satisfactory alternative is found to abate such nuisance such birds may be destroyed in such numbers and in such manner as is deemed advisable by the health authorities under the supervision of the chief of police  dead animalsdisposition of when the sanitation inspector shall be informed of any dead animal within the city definitions shall apply in the interpretation and enforcement of this article 1 abandon the word abandon shall mean the intentional act of leaving an animal to survive on its own or placing an animal upon public or private property or within a public building unattended or uncared for 2 certificate the word certificate shall mean a certificate issued at the time of vaccination of the dog and bearing thereon the signature of the vaccinator the vaccination tag number the name color breed and sex of the dog the name and address of the owner and the date of expiration of the vaccination 3 current license tag the term current license tag shall mean a license tag issued for the year in question except that a person shall have of any year to secure a license tag for such a year provided a license tag for the prior year has already been purchased and is affixed to the collar of the dog 4 current vaccination tag the term current vaccination tag shall mean a metal tag or certificate issued by the georgia department of human resources which bears a number showing that it is current for a oneyear or a threeyear period 5 dog the word dog shall mean dog or any domesticated canine of either sex whether or not vaccinated against rabies 6 health officer the words health officer shall mean the commissioner of health of fulton county or his authorized representative which includes officers or employees of the atlanta humane society for prevention of cruelty to animals inc so long as such corporation is under contract with fulton county and city of east point to operate the dog pound and perform animal and rabies control services 7 license tag the term license tag shall mean a metal tag issued on behalf of east point by the health officer and bearing the words fulton county and a license number 8 person the word person shall be defined as in section 11003 of this 9 pound the word pound shall mean the facilities operated by the health officer for confining dogs impounded under the provisions of this regulation 10 vaccinate the word vaccinate shall mean the injection by a veterinarian of a specified dose of antirabies vaccine into the musculature of a dog such vaccine having the us government license number approval stamped on label of vaccine container and having been approved by the state department of human resources vaccine used for vaccination of dogs against rabies shall be refrigerated and kept under proper conditions and shall show no signs of spoilage or otherwise be unfit for procuring immunity against rabies 11 vaccination tag the term vaccination tag shall mean a metal tag issued by the georgia department of human resources to licensed veterinarians in the state of georgia and supplied by such veterinarians to owners upon vaccination 12 veterinarian the word veterinarian shall mean any person who holds a license to practice the profession of veterinary medicine issued by the state board of veterinary medicine a   8105 vaccination and licensing of dogs a the owner or possessor of each dog over four 4 months of age kept maintained or harbored within the municipal limits of the city of east point at any time during the year shall apply for and obtain a license tag for such dog which shall be affixed to a collar worn by such dog at all times this provision does not apply to show dogs wherein the wearing of a collar may suffer damage to the coat of the animal owners of show dogs shall have in their possession the dog tag where it may be produced on demand of animal control authority b dogs four 4 months of age or less shall resources d such license tag shall be issued on behalf of fulton county by the health officer who shall make the tag available for sale from january 1 each year for current year and throughout the procure a license tag by may 1 of each year shall subject a dog owner to a penalty charge in addition to the license fee as determined by fulton county for each month beginning in may for the balance of the current license period b rabies cases to be reported it shall be the duty of any person knowing of a rabid animal or an animal showing rabid symptoms to immediately report such animal to the health officer and give as much additional pertinent information as possible c quarantine a where rabies has been found to exist in any warmblooded animal or where its existence is suspected the health officer may designate an area within which quarantine of all such animals shall be maintained and all such animals shall thereupon be immediately confined to the premises designated by the health officer in a manner approved by the health officer whether or not such animal has been vaccinated against rabies b no animal shall be removed from or brought into a quarantined area or premises without written approval of the health officer c quarantine ordered by the health officer shall be maintained for such period as the health officer deems necessary to protect the public health d quarantined areas or premises and areas where rabid animals or animals suspected of rabies remain at large may be posted by the health officer with signs which read as follows rabies suspected or rabieskeep away from animals such signs shall be conspicuously displayed in a place designated by the health officer and shall not be defaced or removed except by the health officer signs furnished and approved by the health officer shall be used e the owner or custodian of each animal subject to a quarantine invoked by the health officer under terms of this regulation shall be notified of the quarantine the particular animals subject thereto and shall be given such other information as the health officer deems necessary f the heads of all animals having had rabies or suspected of having had rabies at time of death shall be submitted to the health officer for examination by the georgia department of human resources laboratory d impoundment of dogs a dogs or other animals within any of the following classes may be captured and impounded in east point 1 dogs whose ownership is unknown  2 vicious dogs of all kinds  a dog shall be deemed vicious when the same is of an ugly disposition and is prone to unprovoked attacks on persons or other animals  3 dogs in heat off premises of their owners  4 dogs or other animals which have bitten a person or animal or which have been bitten by a dog or animal suspected of having rabies  5 dogs not tagged with an unexpired fulton county license tag  6 dogs not wearing a current vaccination tag  7 dogs which have strayed from the premises of their owners  8 wandering dogs  9 dogs suspected of having rabies  10 unconfined dogs in quarantine areas b no dog shall be exempted from this provision by virtue of vaccination license tag or certificate c when a dogs owner can be readily identified and located the health officer shall notify the owner that such dog has been impounded if any impounded dog is not claimed within three 3 days of the date such dog is impounded such dog shall be disposed of in a manner approved by the health officer  provided that animals under observation for rabies symptoms shall remain in the pound for such period of time as the health officer may deem necessary to protect the public health  and provided that the health officer may at his discretion offer for adoption any dog not redeemed or claimed within three 3 days by the person having right of possession to any person desiring the dog but only after such person has complied with all applicable provisions of this regulation and has paid the pound and vaccination fee hereinafter set out d before a dogs being released to the owner the owner of any unvaccinated dog shall pay to the health officer a fee as determined by fulton county which shall include a pound fee and the cost of vaccination dogs that have been vaccinated and licensed before becoming impounded shall be released to their owners within three 3 days after capture upon payment of pound fee provided the health officer is of the opinion that such release will not impair the safety of the public in addition to the pound fee the health officer shall be entitled to charge a boarding fee as determined by fulton county per day for dogs boarded in excess of twentyfour 24 hours after notification to the owner every animal impounded under provisions of this regulation which is found upon arrival at the pound to be diseased or injured and whose owner is unknown or relinquishes ownership in writing shall be immediately destroyed if not accepted by an organization approved by the health officer provided such organization signs a receipt for the animal e every animal showing clinical signs of rabies as determined by a veterinarian shall be immediately destroyed and the head of such animal shall be sent to the laboratory of the georgia department of human resources f the health officer shall exercise every reasonable care to prevent injury illness death escape or pilfering of any dog with which he deals in carrying out the provisions of this regulation but he shall not be responsible for any such occurrence g within the corporate limits of east point it shall be unlawful for the owner or any other person having custody of any dog or other canine animal to allow or permit such dog to go off the premises of the owner or such other person having custody of the animal unless such animal shall be securely under leash by the owner or some other competent person h the above requirements shall not apply in any area zoned for agricultural purposes where the owner or other person having custody of the dog is at the time in question using the dog for hunting purposes has the dog in his possession or control at the time and has on his person a valid and existing hunting license at the time dogs while hunting or show dogs are not required to wear a collar or dog tag but the owner shall have the dog tag in his possession where it may be shown upon demand of animal control authority e kennels a where there are four 4 or more dogs each over the age of four 4 months kept maintained or harbored at one 1 household the premises shall be deemed to constitute a kennel and every kennel shall be subject to regulation and inspection by the health officer b all commercial kennels which are subject to a business license fee from city shall be exempt from the requirement of a separate license fee for each dog located in such kennel owners of kennels as constituted under this paragraph will not be issued dog tags for their animals but shall have in their possession the business license where it may be shown upon demand by the animal control authority f criminal responsibility of dog owners it is hereby declared to be unlawful for any person owning or having custody of a dog within the city to allow a violation of any of the provisions of this article  6479 editors note at the editors discretion  1 of enacted similar subject matter and derived from  8789   121895   cross reference vacant buildings pt 7 ch 4 findings 1 the city council finds that public nuisances exist in the city of east point in the operation of certain establishments and the use of property in violation of certain georgia statutes and the ordinances city of east point georgia which nuisances cause hurt inconvenience or damage to others and substantially and seriously interfere with the interest of the public in the quality of life and total community environment commerce in the city property values and the public health safety and welfare 2 the city council further finds i that the continued occurrence of such activities and violations is detrimental to the health sanitation cleanliness welfare and safety of the people of the city and of the businesses thereof and the visitors thereto and ii that the continued occurrence of such activities and violations is further detrimental to the peace good order and dignity of the city and to the welfare and morals of the citizens of the city 3 it is the purpose of the council pursuant to sections 110428 110429 110432 and 6109 of the city charter to authorize and empower the city court and officials of the city to impose sanctions and penalties for such public nuisances and such power of such officials may be exercised either in conjunction with or apart from the powers contained in other laws without prejudice to the use of procedures and remedies available under such other laws 4 the council further finds that the sanctions and penalties imposed by the city pursuant to this ordinance constitute an additional and appropriate method of law enforcement in response to the proliferation of the abovedescribed public nuisances the sanctions and penalties are reasonable and necessary in order to protect the health and safety of the people of the city and to promote the general welfare  9605 definitions as used in this chapter the term 1 adverse impact includes but is not limited to the following any search warrants served on the property where controlled substances andor weapons were seized  investigative purchases of controlled substances on or near the property by law enforcement agencies or their agents  arrests for violations of controlled substance law and or possession of weapons  loitering for the purposes of engaging in illegal activity  an increase in the volume of traffic associated with property  complaints made to law enforcement officials of illegal activity associated with the property  and finding of illegal weapons or controlled substances on or near property by law enforcement officials and their agents 2 buildings dwellings or structures mean any building or structure or part thereof used and occupied for human habitation commercial industrial or business uses or intended to be so used and includes any outhouses and appurtenances belonging thereto or usually enjoyed therewith and also includes any building or structure of any design 3 business means an activity occupation employment or enterprise which requires time attention labor and material and wherein merchandise is exhibited or sold or services offered 4 closing means securing and causing a dwelling building or structure to be vacated 5 director means the east point chief of police or his duly authorized appointee 6 disturbance means actions behavior or conduct by person or persons at a particular location that disturbs the peace 7 drug crime means an act which is a violation of of of title 16 of the official georgia controlled substances act 8 dwellings buildings or structures means any building or structure or part thereof used and occupied for human habitation commercial industrial or business uses or intended to be so used and includes any outhouses and appurtenances belonging thereto or usually enjoyed therewith and also includes any building or structure of any design as used in this chapter the term dwellings buildings or structures shall not mean or include any farm any building or structure located on a farm or any agricultural facility or other building or structure used or the production growing raising harvesting storage or processing of crops livestock poultry or other farm products 9 lot means a parcel of land with or without buildings dwellings or structures 10 nuisance means for purposes of this chapter the condition existing whenever of any of the following provisions resulting from separate incidents at a building dwelling or structure or immediately adjacent to the building dwelling or structure or on any lot as a result of the operation of the business twelve 12 or more points are accumulated within a period of six 6 months or eighteen 18 or more points within a period of twelve 12 months in accordance with the following point system where more than one 1 violation occurs during a single incident the total points for the incident shall be the highest point value assigned to any single violation the determination of the accumulation of points shall be made by the director a the following violations shall be assigned a point value of six 6 points i controlled substances offenses  ii gambling offenses  iii prostitution offenses  iv illegal possession of firearms and other dangerous weapons  v offenses against children  vi offenses involving alcoholic beverages  vii possession of stolen property viii permitting the premises to become disorderly including suffering or permitting fighting or lewdness  ix disorderly conduct by individual or individuals  and x penal law violations including but not limited to murder attempted murder assault attempted assault sex offenses etc b the following violations shall be assigned a point value of four 4 points i violation of the fire prevention code city et seq  ii violation of any noise ordinance of the city  iii violation of the building code city et seq and 109001 et seq  iv violation of the property maintenance code city et seq  v violation of the zoning regulations of the city city et seq  vi any violation of of the ordinances city of east point georgia not addressed in subsections 740027a or 740027c  and vii allowing persons on the premises in excess in excess of occupancy limits c the following violations shall be assigned a point value of three 3 points i any violation of of the ordinances city of east point georgia not addressed in subsections 740027a or 740027b  ii operating a business at the premises in a manner which causes it to be a source of disruption for the neighborhood andor a focal point of police attention  and iii general disturbances at a particular location 11 occupant means any person including domestic service employees living and or sleeping in a dwelling unit or having possession of a space within a building dwelling or structure 12 operator means any person who has charge care or control of a building dwelling or structure which is let or offered for occupancy 13 owner means any person agent operator firm or corporation having a legal or equitable interest in the property  or recorded in the official records of the state county or municipality as holding title to the property  or otherwise having control of the property including the guardian of the estate or any such person and the executor or administrator of the estate of such person if ordered to take possession of real property by a court 14 parties in interest means persons in possession of dwellings buildings or structures and all individuals associations and corporations who have interest of record in the county where the property is located in a dwelling building or structure including executors administrators guardians and trustees 15 persistent nuisance means any nuisance as determined to exist by the director which exists unabated for a period of twelve 12 or more months a responsible party means any owner occupant agent manager operator andor management company of a building dwelling structure or lot b testimony means oral written or other documented evidence tending to show or prove the truth of the matter asserted c violation means conduct or evidence of conduct prohibited under this chapter a violation does not require criminal prosecution and conviction but only a preponderance of evidence that the prohibited conduct is occurring or has occurred evidence of prohibited conduct may include but is not limited to  police reports investigative reports execution of search warrants results of police surveillance arrest andor conviction of local state or federal laws activities associated with trafficking of controlled substances finding of weapons andor controlled substances on or near the property or increase volume of traffic associated with the property 16 public authority means any housing authority or any officer who is in charge of any department or branch of the government of the city of east point relating to health fire or building regulations or to other activities concerning dwellings buildings or structure in the city 17 public officer means the officer or officers who are authorized by this chapter to exercise the powers prescribed by this chapter or any agent of such officer or officers 18 repair means closing a dwelling building or structure or the cleaning or removal of debris trash or other materials present and accumulated which create a health or safety hazard in or about any dwelling building or structure 19 resident means any person residing in the affected jurisdiction on or before the date on which the alleged nuisance arose  9605   32006 evidence 1 in any action under this evidence of the common fame and general reputation of the building dwelling or structure of the inhabitants or occupants thereof or of those resorting thereto shall be competent evidence to prove the existence of a property or building nuisance 2 if evidence of the general reputation of the building dwelling or structure or of the inhabitants or occupants thereof is sufficient to establish the existence of the nuisance it shall be prima facie evidence of knowledge thereof and acquiescence and participation therein and responsibility for the nuisance on the part of the owners lessors lessees and all those in possession of or having charge of as agent or otherwise or having any interest in any form in the property real or personal used in conducting or maintaining the property or building nuisance 3 for any building dwelling or structure or lot wherein within a one 1 year period prior to the commencement of an action under this chapter there have occurred four 4 or more violations on the part of the lessees owners operators or occupants of the provisions of this chapter there shall be a rebuttal presumption that a public nuisance exists at said location 4 any building dwelling or structure or lot wherein within a one year period prior to the commencement of an action under this chapter there has been presented a preponderance of evidence of repeated criminal activity which has an adverse impact on such property or neighborhood shall be prima facie evidence that a public nuisance exists at said location  9605 civil remedies for property and building nuisances 1 the city attorney upon request of the director or the city council may bring and maintain a civil proceeding in the name of the city for the following types of relief a permanent injunction b temporary closing order c temporary restraining order or d temporary injunction a the city attorney shall name as defendants the building dwelling or structure or lot wherein the public nuisance is being conducted maintained or permitted by describing it by tax map number andor street address and at least one of the owners of some part of or interest in the property b the city attorney shall bring and maintain a civil proceeding in the name of the city in the city court of the city of east point or any other court of competent jurisdiction including the superior court of fulton county to permanently enjoin the public nuisance and the persons conducting maintaining or permitting the public nuisance from further conducting maintaining or permitting the public nuisance the owner operator andor lessee of a building dwelling structure or lot wherein the public nuisance is being conducted maintained or permitted may be made defendants in the action c the venue of such action shall be in the county where the public nuisance is being conducted maintained or permitted d the existence of an adequate remedy at law shall not prevent the granting of temporary or permanent relief pursuant to this chapter e the civil action shall be commenced by the filing of a summons and complaint alleging the facts constituting the nuisance f the complaint shall name as defendants the building dwelling structure or lot wherein the nuisance is being conducted maintained or permitted by describing it by district and lot number andor street address and at least one of the owners who possess some part of or an interest in the property g any complaint filed under this chapter shall be verified or accompanied by affidavits for purposes of showing that the owner or hisher agent has notice of the nuisance and has had an opportunity to abate the nuisance h the complaint or affidavit shall contain a description of the attempts by the applicant to notify and locate the owner of the property andor the owners agent i the complaint or affidavit shall describe the adverse impact associated with the property on the surrounding neighborhood j in rem jurisdiction shall be complete over the building dwelling structure or lot wherein the public nuisance is being conducted maintained or permitted by affixing the summons to the door of the building dwelling structure or lot and by mailing the summons by certified or registered mail return receipt requested to one of the owners who possesses some part of or an interest in the property proof of service shall be filed within two 2 days thereafter with the clerk of the court designated in the summons service shall be complete upon such filing k defendants other than the building dwelling structure or lot wherein the public nuisance is being conducted maintained or permitted shall be served with the summons in any manner lawfully provided in the laws of the state of georgia governing legal summons l with respect to any action commenced or to be commenced pursuant to this chapter the city attorney shall file a notice of lis pendens pursuant to the provisions of ocga 4414610 et seq m the owner of the real estate affected by the action shall be presumed to be the person in whose name the real estate is recorded in the office of the clerk of fulton county n whenever there is testimony that a person was the manager operator supervisor or in any other way in charge of the premises at the time a public nuisance was being conducted maintained or permitted such evidence shall be presumptive that he or she was an agent or employee of the owner or lessee of the building dwelling structure or lot considered to be a nuisance o if upon the trial of an action under this chapter or upon a motion for summary judgment in an action under this chapter a finding is made that the defendant has conducted maintained or permitted a public nuisance defined in this chapter a penalty may be awarded in an amount not to exceed one thousand dollars $100000 for each day it is found that the defendant conducted maintained or permitted the public nuisance after notice to abate has been given by the city upon recovery such penalty shall be paid into the general fund of the city p a judgment pursuant to this chapter shall be enforced by the city police department and the office of city attorney 3 permanent injunction a a judgment awarding a permanent injunction pursuant to this chapter may direct the police department to seize and remove from the building dwelling structure or lot all personal property material equipment and instrumentalities used in the creation and maintenance of the public nuisance and shall direct the sale by the police department of such property in the manner provided for the sale of personal property in the same manner as provided for the sale of unclaimed lost or stolen property in section 61028 of this net proceeds of any such sale after deduction of the lawful expenses involved shall be paid into the general fund of the city b a judgment awarding a permanent injunction pursuant to this chapter may authorize agents of the city to forthwith remove and correct construction and structural alterations in violation of city codes any and all costs associated with these repairs or alterations shall become a lien against said property and shall have priority before any mortgage or other lien that exists prior to such filing except tax and assessment liens and any nuisance abatement lien c a judgment awarding a permanent injunction pursuant to this chapter may direct the closing of the building dwelling structure or lot by the police department to the extent necessary to abate the nuisance and shall direct the police department to post a copy of the judgment and a printed notice of such closing mutilation or removal of such a posted judgment or notice while it remains in force in addition to any other punishment prescribed by law shall be punishable on conviction by a fine of not more than five hundred dolars $50000 or by imprisonment not exceeding fifteen 15 days or by both provided such judgment contains therein a notice of such penalty d the closing directed by the judgment shall be for such period as the court may direct but in no event shall the closing be for a period of more than one 1 year from the posting of the judgment provided for in this subdivision e if the owner shall file a bond in the value of the property ordered to be closed and submits proof to the court that the nuisance has been abated and will not be created maintained or permitted for such period of time as the building dwelling structure or lot has been directed to be closed in the judgment the court may vacate the provisions of the judgment that direct the closing of the building dwelling structure or lot f a closing by the police department pursuant to this subdivision shall not constitute an act of possession ownership or control by the police department of the closed premises g intentional disobedience or resistance to any provision of a judgment awarding a permanent injunction pursuant to this chapter in addition to any other punishment prescribed by law shall be punishable by a fine of not more than one thousand dollars $100000 or by imprisonment not exceeding one hundred twenty 120 days or by both h upon the request of the city attorney or the city council the police department shall assist in the enforcement of a judgment awarding a permanent injunction entered in an action brought pursuant to this chapter i a judgment rendered awarding a permanent injunction pursuant to this chapter shall be and become a lien upon the building dwelling structure or lot named in the complaint in such action such lien to date from the time of filing a notice of liens pending in the injunction a generally i pending an action for a permanent injunction as provided for in this article the court may grant a preliminary injunction enjoining a public nuisance within the scope of this time ii unless the court orders otherwise a temporary closing order together with the papers upon which it was based and a notice of hearing for the preliminary injunction shall be personally served conducting maintaining or permitting a public nuisance within the scope of this chapter and shall enter upon the building dwelling structure or lot for such purpose such inventory shall be taken in any manner which is deemed likely to evidence a true and accurate representation of the personal property subject to such inventory including but not limited to photographing such personal property g the officers serving a temporary restraining order shall upon service of the order command all persons present in the building dwelling structure or lot to vacate the premises forthwith upon the building dwelling structure or lot being vacated the premises shall be securely locked and all keys delivered to the officers serving the order who thereafter shall deliver the keys to the fee owner lessor or lessee of the building dwelling structure or lot involved if the fee owner lessor or lessee is not at the building dwelling structure or lot when the order is being executed the officers removal of property is prohibited by court order if the temporary restraining order directs that the premises are to be closed by court order the notice shall contain the legend closed by court order in block lettering of sufficient size to be observed by anyone intending or likely to enter the premises the date of the order the court from which issued and the name of the office or agency posting the notice mutilation or removal of such a posted order or such a posted notice while it remains in force in addition to any other punishment prescribed by law shall be punishable on conviction by a including the temporary receiver or on its own initiative the appointing court may remove a temporary receiver at any time b the temporary receiver shall have such powers and duties as the court shall direct including but not limited to collecting and holding all rents due from all tenants leasing or renting portions of the building or structure making or authorizing other persons to make necessary repairs or to maintain the property hiring security or other personnel necessary for the safe and proper operation of a dwelling prosecuting or defending suits flowing from his or her management of
